Originally from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Chantha is aged 27 years old. She has one daughter who is dependent on her and in school. Chantha and her husband have been in rice farming and fishing for several years to make a living. She is able to earn KHR10,000 per day to help meet her family’s needs. 

This is the first loan for Chantha’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading the group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income so as to make a good living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
Nat is aged 41 and married. She lives in a rural village in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been in rice farming for several years while her husband is a motor taxi driver. She can earn approximately KHR 20,000 per day from the current business. Her crops have been destroyed by flood and this is the main challenge for her.

Nat’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and she is a second cycle client. She is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. She used the first loan successfully to better support her family. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to generate more income from her current business so as to fulfill her dream to run a new business to earn a larger income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Vith's Group

texts.en:
Vith is a 27-year-old mother of two children, who are still small, living in a village of the Sa Ang district, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer in the local area while her husband is a paid truck driver. She has been in this business for six years, earning about 17,300KHR per day and can save around 9,000KHR each day after expenses.

This is the second micro loan for Vith's group with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She has completely paid back the first loan which has helped her to improve her living conditions. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it for gasoline to carry water into her rice field. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and sell it for a good price to make a better living .

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Nawindsongti Group

texts.fr:
Mme NAWINEBARKA  est la représentante du groupe NAWINDSONGTI. Mme se porte bien. Elle est mariée  et mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 22ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. Les 06 vont à l’école. Elle a 06 personnes en charge.

Elle transforme et vend du soumbala  depuis  1998 (15ans). Elle est aussi tisserante depuis quelques mois. Mme a pu acheter ses grain de néré et fils de tisse. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de Bissighin  en ville .Ses clients sont  les  femmes et hommes.

Elle veut  s’acheter  03 sacs de grains de néré pour la fabrication du soumbala et 03 douzaines de rouleaux de  fil de tisse.

 Elle utilise  ses bénéfices pour agrandir son activité. Avec son crédit, tout s’est bien passé. Mme a eu plus de clients et a bien s’occuper de sa famille. Elle souhaiterait satisfaire tous ses clients par ce nouveau prêt. Ainsi elle pourrait mieux s’occuper de sa famille. Elle ambitionne accroitre son activité de vente de soumbala, de tissage et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. NAWINEBARKA is the leader of the NAWINDSONGTI group.  She is doing well.  She is married and the mother of six children.  The oldest is 22 and the youngest is 6.  All of them attend school.  She has six people in her care. 
She has been making and selling soumbala since 1998 (15 years).  She also has been weaving  for the past few months.  She has been able to buy locust tree grain and rolls of weaving thread.  She gets her supplies at the market in Bissighin in town.  Her customers are men and women.  
She would like to buy three sacks of locust tree grain to make soumbala and three dozen rolls of weaving thread.  
She will use her profits to grow her business.  Her business is going well because of her loan.  Mrs. Nawinebarka has had a growing number of customers and has been able to care for her family.  She would like to be able to meet the demands of all her customers with this new loan.   She will be better able to take care of her family.  Her goal is to expand her soumbala and fabric sales and to take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of locust tree grain to make soumbala, and three dozen rolls of weaving thread.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her current stock

loans.name: Chhim's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Sa Ang district, Chhim is 47 years old and married with eight children, five of whom are dependents and in still school. The main sources of family's income are from rice farming and a ginger plantation. She and her husband have been in this business for several years earning about 14,200KHR per day to feed the children. 

This is group loan for Chhim with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She has been with VisionFund for two cycles and successfully paid back the loans. After the successful loans that have relieved her family's financial burden, she is leading another four members to apply for a loan of 1,000,000KHR each. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for gasoline to carry water into her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her business and earn a larger income so as to better her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: True Go Lass Group

texts.en:
Abass is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Abass was born in Tonkolili district, in Northern Sierra Leone 29 years ago. He is married to a trader and the couple has 1 child who is not of school-going age. For over 11 years now, Abass has been selling ready-to-wear-clothes.

With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Abass will use his share of the loan (2,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to expand his business, he will buy clothes in larger quantity to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy clothes in larger quantity to add to his current stock

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
A widow from a village of the Sa Ang district, Pov is aged 44 years old and has three children who are staying with the family and have their own employment. She is a peasant who has been planting soybeans for ten years and she supplements her income by fishing and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 11,000KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for Pov's group consisting of five members who live in the same village. She successfully used the first micro loan to better feed her children and set aside some money for the future. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. She will use her portion to buy seeds for her crop business. She hopes to make more crops so as to increase her family's income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her crop business.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 30 años, su pareja es Melissa, de 24 años, con quien tiene dos hijos de 6 y 2 años. La casa donde viven es de unos familiares. 
Él se dedica a la agricultura y a las labores del campo desde hace 12 años, esta experiencia le da la seguridad de producir frutos sanos. En su localidad las papas son muy requeridas gracias a los suelos fértiles que tienen. Él siembra principalmente las variedades “Canchán”, “Yungay” y “Única”, porque son las que más vende y son las que la población busca. Por esa razón viaja constantemente hacia la ciudad de Lima donde comercializa sus cosechas al por mayor. Para esto le ayuda de su esposa, quien agiliza los contactos para las ventas, pues ella viaja cuando él se encuentra en el campo. Su meta es incrementar su producción, para ello arrendarán más terrenos.

Este es su crédito número 13 con MFP y menciona que la ayuda recibida fue de gran ayuda para su emprendimiento. Como en ocasiones anteriores, esta vez también promete ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Y lo que le agrada del trabajo con su banco comunal “Las Águilas” son los ahorros mensuales.
El dinero de este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de papas (1000 soles), 1200 para fertilizantes y con lo restante comprará insecticidas y pagará al personal que trabajará con él.
texts.en:
José is 30 years old.  His partner is Melissa, 24 years old, with whom he has two children who are 6 and 2 years old.  They live in the house of some relatives.  He has made a living in agriculture and farm work for 12 years.  This experience gives him the security to produce healthy fruits.  In his town potatoes are very much in demand thanks to the fertile soils that they have.  He mainly plants the “Canchán”, “Yungay” and “Única” varieties because they are the ones that he sells the most and are the ones for which the population searches.  For this reason he travels constantly to the city of Lima where he sells his crops wholesale.  His wife helps him in this; it is she who makes the contacts for the sales, as she travels when he is in the fields.  His goal is to increase his production, for that they will lease more land.

This is his 13th loan with MFP and he mentions that the assistance received was of great help for his enterprise.  As on previous occasions, he promises this time as well to be punctual in the payment of his installments.  And what he likes about working with the communal bank “Las Águilas” are the monthly savings.  He will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of potato seeds (1000 PEN), 1200 (PEN) for fertilizer and with the remainder he will buy insecticides and pay the staff who will work with him.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds (1000 PEN), fertilizers (1200 PEN), insecticides and to pay his staff.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of three children, Channy is 32 years old. She lives in a rural area in the Moung Russey district in the province of Battambang. To support her family, she has been rice farming on seven hectares of farmland for nearly 10 years. She earns about KHR 10,000 per day to meet her family’s needs.
 
Channy’s group consists of two female members who live in the same village. Channy is the second cycled client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and has completely paid back the previous loan, which has helped her to live better. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Channy will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to repair her hand tractor. She hopes this loan will enable her to fix her hand tractor so it will function well, which will increase her income. She hopes to set aside some money to have a decent house in which to live.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and to repair her hand tractor.

loans.name: Soknan's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Thmor Koul district of the Battambang province, Soknan is 27 years old. She is married with two children, one daughter and one son. All of her children are under her care and are still in school. 

Soknan has earned a living through farming rice on two hectares of farmland for several years. The main challenge to her crop yield is it has been destroyed by insects.

This is the first loan for Soknan’s Group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now Soknan is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Soknan is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy pesticides for protecting her paddy-field. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her living status.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy pesticides for protecting her paddy-field.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ousmane travaille comme vendeur dans une pharmacopée situé près du guichet ou il a ouvert un compte. Il est âgé de 27 ans et est marié. Il est à sa première expérience de crédit et vient solliciter un montant de 50000F CFA afin de pouvoir acquérir un lit. Puisque ses revenus sont minimes et que les charges sont là, il ne peut que profiter d’un crédit payé mensuellement pour pouvoir s’équiper convenablement. 
Il paye son loyer et sa nourriture et s’occupe de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Ousmane works as a salesman in a pharmacopoeia located near the branch where he opened an account. He is 27 years old and is married.

This is his first experience taking out a loan. He is seeking a loan of 50,000 CFA in order to purchase a bed. Since his revenue is small and the expenses are there, he can only benefit from a loan paid monthly to be able to properly equip himself.

He pays his rent and food and supports his small family.

loans.use: to buy a bed for his own personal use

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly, age 61, lives in a thatched-roof house in a rural village in the Mongkul Borey district of Pursat, Cambodia. Ly is married, and she and her husband have five children. They earn a living through growing rice on one hectare of farmland. They also supplement the family’s income by selling grocery items in the local area. Having been in this business for nearly 20 years, Ly earns about 30,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Ly has been with VisionFund for six cycles while the other members have been with VisionFund for three to six cycles. Ly has completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her support her current business. 

Now leading her group of three to request a loan, Ly will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy more grocery items for selling. She hopes to earn more income so as to save some money to buy a prosper motor to help her business be more efficient.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and to buy more grocery items for selling.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Marlize

texts.en:
Marlize, a married mother of three, lives in the Changamwe area of Coast province, Kenya, where she owns a tailoring shop that she has been operating for 16 years now. Her main challenges are purchasing stock due to high prices of materials and customers delaying payments.

Marlize, who learnt about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group, is requesting a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to buy fabric rolls and sewing threads. Her extra income will be added to her savings to pay school fees and access better health facilities. She aspires to expand and open a uniform store.

loans.use: to buy fabric rolls and sewing threads.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu lives in the Changamwe area of the province of Coast in Kenya. She is married and has three children. 

Tatu owns a food cafe, a business she has been operating for one year now. Apart from this, she owns a transport business where she earns a salary.

Tatu learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group. She joined with the goal of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation as well as customers not paying on time.

Tatu is applying for a loan of 83,500 KES to renovate her café and to buy maize flour, cereals, cooking oil and charcoal. Her extra income will be added to her savings to pay her children's school fees and improve her living standard. She aspires to expand her business into a larger restaurant.

loans.use: To renovate her café and buy maize flour, cereals, cooking oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 37-year-old married Lebanese man. He’s a great support for his wife and his two children who are both at school. Ahmad manages the family’s expenses and provides them with a decent life. He started his business many years ago and has had to work really hard to build a worthy career for himself. He has been working as a car mechanic in his own garage, which is in a good location.
 
Today, he would like to receive a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy more car parts and mechanics' tools so that he can respond rapidly to his clients’ needs. He believes that acting properly and honestly is essential to attract more customers and to continue building a good future career. One of his greatest dreams is to further expand his business, which will hopefully increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy more car parts and tools for his business

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar, 31 years old, lives with her husband Ali and their three school-attending children. Although Sahar should be taking care of her children, she is obliged to work continually as she is responsible for supporting her husband, who has been working as a photographer out of the country, with their family expenses.

Sahar opened her own clothing shop in 2010, providing her customers with good quality products at fair prices. She is satisfied with what she has attained so far, even though she wishes to enhance her family’s way of living as much as possible. Thus Sahar is requesting a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new collection of clothes that will increase her earnings.

Her husband and children trust her, knowing that she is a brave woman who can handle problems however complicated they may be.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia is a 46-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and four children. Two of them are studying and the others started to work.  
She and her husband have been able to satisfy the family's needs and respond to their demands.  

Fadia owns a small minimarket where she sells all kinds of dairy products, soft drinks and many other daily products. As for her husband, he also has had his own independent business for 15 years.
  
Today, she’s asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed quantity of food provisions for her minimarket. In that way, she will be able to diversify her items and therefore increase her revenues and improve her way of living. Fadia looks forward to expanding her grocery, waiting the perfect time to open other branches and assigning her children these branches’ ownership.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of food provisions for her minimarket.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 21-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents. 

He has been working in selling and repairing electrical generators for many years. He has his own shop located in his town. He became expert in this occupation after dealing with very complicated problems. His business income is very important as it represents a necessary support for his father.

Today, he is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tools for his business in addition to a fair quantity of spare parts. He states that these purchases will facilitate his business operations and help him attract more customers. This is his first Kiva loan and he hopes to be able to improve his business as well as the family’s financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for his business in addition to a fair quantity of spare parts.

loans.name: Rosa Edith

texts.es:
Rosa vive en la calurosa ciudad de Pucallpa, ubicada en la maravillosa selva peruana, en la cual podemos ver flora y fauna maravillosa y tiene unos paisajes tan bonitos que hacen que uno se desconecte del bullicio de la ciudad, tiene una variada gastronomía y también muy conocida por la amabilidad de sus pobladores. Rosa en su tiempo libre le gusta mucho salir a pasear con su hija y también junto a ella comer uno d sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ceviche”.

Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo dedicación Rosa trabaja en un colegio como profesora de educación primaria, en un colegio que se encuentra en una zona un poco alejada de su ciudad, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y también tiene su pequeño negocio de alquiler de habitaciones, con lo cual tiene un ingreso mas para los gastos de su hogar; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo y su negocio porque tiene mucha amabilidad con sus alumnos y clientes y sobre todo que trabaja con muchos ganas de salir adelante.

Rosa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en las habitaciones que alquila, ya que colocara pisos de cemento ya que actualmente son de tierra y podrá realizar refacciones en las paredes; de esta manera ella podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a los turistas que atiende y así poder mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando y luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hija y poder tener un hotel como negocio”.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in the warm and delightful city of Pucallpa.  In the city, which is located in the Peruvian jungle, you can see impressive flora and fauna. Its scenery is so beautiful that it makes one disconnect from the noise of the city and appreciate the beauty of nature.  It has a varied cuisine, and it is well known for the amiability of its people.

In her free time Rosa really likes to go for walks with her daughter.  Together with her daughter, she also likes to eat one of their favorite dishes, the delicious “ceviche [raw fish marinated in lime or lemon juice].

With a great deal of effort, and most of all, dedication, Rosa works at a school as an elementary school teacher.  The school is in an area a bit outside of the city.  She works around nine hours a day.  She also has a small business of renting rooms, which gives her another income to use for the household expenses.  She believes it is going well for her in her work and her business because she is very amiable with her students and her customers.  Above all, she works with a great desire to get ahead.

Rosa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have given her she will be able to make improvements to the rooms that she rents.  She will put down cement floors because the rooms currently have dirt floors, and she will be able to fix up the walls.  This way she will be able to offer better service to the tourists she tends to, and she will be able to improve her income.  This will allow her to continue working and struggling each day to make her biggest dream come true, which is to give her daughter a profession and to be able to have a hotel as a business.

loans.use: to make improvements to the rooms in her house that she rents.

loans.name: Young Women Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the "Young Women" group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. This group of entrepreneurs has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, to apply for a loan of 700,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones for each in the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

The leader of this group is 25-year-old Fatima. Born in Makeni city, Fatima is married to a trader and the couple has three children, one of whom is in primary school, while the others are not yet of school-going age. Fatima has been selling second-hand bags for 10 years now, and with her share of this new loan, she will buy a bale of used bags to add to her business.

Imported used items (like bags, shoes, clothes,vehicles, etc.) are very popular amongst the locals in Sierra Leone, as they are cheaper than new items.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used bags to add to her business.

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es:
La Srta.  Adeluz es soltera, tiene 21 años de edad,  actualmente es socia  en la alcancía comunal “Sarita Colonia”  grupo  conformado por 9  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Adeluz trabaja en una tienda que lo inaguro hace un año donde vende prendas de vestir, platos descartables, ganchos y a su vez vende productos de belleza, este trabajo surge  a raíz de que Adeluz quería   estudiar pero sus padres no contaban con los medios económicos para solventar sus estudios es así que Adeluz pone su negocio con el fin de juntar dinero para estudiar y a sus vez brindarle una mejor calidad de vida  a sus padres, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercaderia es decir (pantalones, polos, blusas ).  Adeluz  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y agradece a Edaprospo y kiva por los prestamos.

Adeluz se encuentra en la foto con polo rosado y falda.
texts.en:
Adeluz is 21 years old and single.  She is currently a member of the “Sarita Colonia” communal bank.  The group is comprised of nine members who have different business activities.

Adeluz works at a store that she started a year ago.  She sells clothes, disposable plates, and hangers.  She also sells beauty products.  This work emerged because Adeluz wanted to go to school, but her parents did not have the financial means to pay for her studies.

That is why Adeluz started her business, in order to get together the money to go to school and to give her parents a better quality of life.

In order to continue growing Adeluz requested a new loan to buy merchandise (pants, polo shirts, blouses).  Adeluz will accomplish her goals with a lot of work and effort.  She is grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva for the loans.

In the photo Adeluz is wearing a pink shirt and a skirt.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Imane

texts.en:
Imane is a 33-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and four children who are still studying. 

Even though her husband is working, she decided to have her own business, wishing to support him as much as she can. For this reason, she decided to have her own freelance job in 2008. She has been working in providing legal documentation services and has many customers visiting her to smooth their official documents preparation. 

Today, she’s looking to take a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy a car for her business. This Kiva loan will facilitate her transportation thus her punctuality in delivering the documents to her clients. In the near future, Imane wishes to open her own office and receive clients whenever she wants to.

loans.use: to buy a car for her business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 40 years old and married to Michael, and they are blessed with four children.

She runs a food kiosk and she has been in this business for the last 14 years and gets an income of KES 18,900 per month.

Anna has got a good credit history with KADET Ltd. and she is applying for her third loan of KES 60,000 from KADET, with which she plans to buy food stock, utensils and materials to improve the kiosk. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees and satisfy the family's needs.

She hopes for a successful and profitable business, for her children to finish their education and for a good life for her family.

loans.use: To buy food stock, utensils and materials to improve the kiosk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy personal-use products and to supply his business with products that have been sold out.

loans.name: Compañeros De San Martín De Porres Group

texts.es:
Les presento a Marleny, uno de los miembros del Grupo Compañeras de San Martin De Porres.

Marleny de 43 años tiene 02 hijos y es conviviente. Ella es la presidenta del grupo que está conformado por 07 integrantes, gracias a los prestamos que ella recibe ha podido construir su casa y  acondicionar varias habitaciones que da en alquiler, esta próxima a seguir construyendo un piso mas donde espera hacer mas habitaciones, los ingreso que percibe por el alquiler lo invierte una parte en la educación de sus hijos y otra para seguir  avanzando la construcción de su casa, su mayor deseo es lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales.Marleny también dicta clases de computación a niños y jóvenes del lugar donde reside, para más adelante le gustaría tener un negocio y seguirá  ahorrando para lograr ese propósito. Ella está contenta de saber que muchas personas de todo el mundo la apoyaran en su sueño y les agradece por eso.
*Marleny es la Sra. Que viste casaca marrón y polo blanco.
texts.en:
We present to you Marleny, one of the members of the communal bank "Compañeras de San Martin De Porres."

Marleny, 43, lives with a partner and has 2 children.  She is the president of this group, which is made of up 7 members.  Thanks to the loan that she has received she has been able to build her house and also set up some rooms to rent out.  With this new loan, she will continue to build another floor where she hopes to add more rooms.  She invests part of the income that she receives from the rentals in her children's education, and part to continue adding on to her house.  Her greatest desire is to have her children become professionals.  

Marleny also teaches computer classes to children and young people in the area where she lives.  In the future, she would like to have a business, and she will continue to save in order to reach this goal.  She is pleased to know that many people around the world are supporting her in accomplishing her dreams, and she thanks them for this.

Marleny is the woman in the brown jacket and white polo shirt.

loans.use: to build rooms to rent out

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Hawa. She is married and has one child, age 18 years. 

In 1990, Hawa established her palm oil and gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava) business. She began her business because she wanted to assist in her child's education. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 600,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Hawa now requires this loan in order to increase her stock of palm oil and gari. In the future, Hawa plans to own a store for herself and send her child to the university to study medicine. She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more quantity of palm oil and gari.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Mary. She is married and has three children, age 15, 6 and 5 year. 

In 2007, Mary established her drinks business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in taking care of the children. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 600,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000. Mary now requires this loan in order to buy different types of drinks to meet the needs of her customers. In the future, Mary plans to open more business outlets and build more houses. She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks.

loans.name: Pierina Massiel

texts.es:
Pierina es una joven e 27 años de edad, la cual es madre soltera debido a que el padre de su pequeña la abandono, ella se convirtió en madre y padre para su pequeño y por ello ella se esfuerza mucho para darle lo mejor y sobre todo darle felicidad a pesar de su condición humilde. La vivienda de Pierina se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, la cual se caracteriza por el desarrollo de su agricultura, en especial por el cultivo de arroz, frejoles, maíz, entre otros; asimismo por la diversidad de su gastronomía en especial por uno de sus platos típicos, el cual es el riquísimo “chupe de Camarones”. Debido a su pocos recursos económicos ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Con mucha dedicación Pierina trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de pollo broster, hamburguesas, salchipapas, entre otros, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene  muy buena sazón para la preparación de los mismos.

Pierina está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar bebidas gaseosas para su negocio y también poder comprar sartenes, espátulas, bandejas, entre otros, lo que le permitirá tener los utensilios necesarios para poder realizar su trabajo, de esta manera atenderá mejor a los clientes y sobre todo podrá mejorar sus ingresos, asi ella seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y poder comprar una motocarga”.
texts.en:
Pierina is 27 years old, and is a single mother. The father of her young son abandoned them, and Pierina has become both mother and father to her son. She works very hard to provide for her son and make him happy despite their humble conditions. Pierina and her son live in the city of Camana, which is an area known for its agriculture, especially for the farming of rice, beans, corn and other crops. Camana is also known for its food and rich, traditional dishes, one of the most famous being the “chupe de Camarones” (shrimp sucker). Pierina did not have the resources necessary to get a secondary education, but she would have liked to pursue a career at a university.

Pierina works very hard and operates a small food stand where she sells roasted chicken, hamburgers, hot dogs and other dishes. She works about 10 hour each day, and can attend up to 20 customers in a day. She believes that business is going well because she is very kind to all her customers, and prepares delicious food.

Pierina is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, and hopes to use the resources from this loan to purchase soft drinks for sale at her food stand, as well as pans, spatulas, trays and other utensils that will help make her business run smoothly and improve the quality of her services. She hopes this investment will help her to generate more income and achieve her dream of giving her son a good education and buying a motorized cart to help expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils and soft drinks for her food stand.

loans.name: Experiance 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Marierose est la coordonnatrice de son groupe Expérience. Elle habite dans la région de BRAS-de-Lance d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Marierose a dirigée sa commerce de divers Produits pendant les 5 années et demi. Marierose voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à plus que des chaussures, accessoires pour femmes,  vêtements, etc.

Marierose espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à ouvrir une grande Boutique parce que maintenant elle vende ses Produits dans la marche.

Des autres membres Expérience ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces vendre des produits Alimentaires, chaussures, et charbon.

Marierose dit que sa rêve est de gagner plus argents pour qu’elle achète plus des produits moins chers et d’une meilleure qualité.
texts.en:
Marierose is the coordinator of her group Expérience. She lives in the region of BRAS-de-Lance in Haïti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. 

Marierose has been running her business selling various goods for five and a half years. She would like to use this loan to invest in more than shoes, women's accessories, clothing, etc.

Marierose hopes that this loan will help her to open a large shop because she now sells goods at the market. 

Some other members of Expérience have need of a loan for such businesses as selling grocery items, shoes, and charcoal.

Marierose says that her dream is to earn more money, so she is buying more goods that are cheaper and better in quality.

loans.use: to invest in shoes, accessories for women, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Assurance De Phaeton 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.fr:
Jaccint est le coordinateur de son groupe Assurance de Phaeton. Il habite dans la région de Assurance où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limité.

Jaccint a dirigé son commerce de poisson pendant les 9 dernières années. Il est marie il a 4 enfants. 

Jaccint voudrait utiliser cet emprunt d'investir dans l'achat de poisson. Jaccint espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son entreprise

Des autres membres Assurance ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme charbon, vetements usees et produits alimentaires.
texts.en:
Jaccint is the coordinator of his group Assurance de Phaeton. He lives in the region of Assurance, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. 

Jaccint has been running his fish business for the last nine years. He is married and has four children. 

Jaccint would like to use this loan to invest in buying fish. He hopes that this loan will help him to expand his enterprise. 

Some other members of Assurance have need of a loan for such businesses as charcoal, secondhand clothing, and grocery items.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Sitora

texts.ru: После окончания средней школы, Ситора поставила себе цель стать известным банкиром. С этой целью она поступила в Экономический Университет. Ситора студентка 1 курса. Она очень умная и трудолюбивая девушка. Учиться на отлично и активно участвует на всех мероприятиях университета. Родители Ситоры простые рабочие и они не в состоянии заплатиь за учебу своего ребенка. Ситора обратилась в Имон Интернешенл с целью получения кредита для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: After graduating from secondary school, Sitora has set herself a goal to become a banker of renown. She has been admitted to the University of Economics. She is in her first year of studies. She is a very intelligent and hard-working young woman. She gets top grades and takes active part in the university life. Sitora’s parents are ordinary workers and lack the means of paying for her studies. Sitora has applied to Imon International in order to obtain a loan for paying her university tuition. She is hoping for your kind help.

loans.use: to pay for her university studies.

loans.name: Les Hommes De Dieu Group

texts.fr:
Mr POUSSI est le représentant du groupe LES HOMMES DE DIEU. Il est marié et père de quatre(04) enfants. Le plus âgé a 13 ans et le moins âgé a 7 mois. Parmi ses enfants trois (03) vont à l’école. Il a six (06) personnes en charge.
	Mr POUSSI est électricien et vend  de fils électrique depuis 32 ans.il s’approvisionne dans les grandes boutiques de Ouagadougou. Il vend ses fils sur place à Ouaga et en province.

	Mr POUSSI veut s’acheter 10 rouleaux de fils électrique.

	Mr utilise ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité et soutenir sa famille. Il ambitionne devenir un vendeur grossiste de fis électriques pour gagner plus et mieux s’occuper de sa  famille.
texts.en:
Mr. POUSSI is the representative of the group LES HOMMES DE DIEU. He is married and the father of four children. The oldest is 13 years old, and the youngest is 7 months old. Among his children, three go to school. He has six persons to support. 

Mr. POUSSI is an electrician and has been selling electrical wire for 32 years. He gets his supplies from big stores in Ouagadougou. He sells his wire locally in Ouaga and around the province.

Mr. POUSSI wants to buy 10 rolls of electrical wire. 

Mr. POUSSI uses his profits to strengthen his business and to support his family. His ambition is to become a wholesale vendor of electrical wire in order to earn more and to take better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy 10 rolls of electrical wire

loans.name: Rosa Jesus

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 61 años, es soltera, vive con sus queridos Padres en la ciudad de Ica, ella es una persona muy alegre, trabajadora y entusiasta, que siempre ha tenido un gran deseo de superación, lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven para apoyar a sus padres no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de Enfermería, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con sus Padres quienes ya son ancianos y se encuentran bajo su cuidado, en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para engreírlos.
Gracias al apoyo de su familia, con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Rosa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de frituras y bebidas, desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10  horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar los acabados de su vivienda, tales como la puesta de piso y pintado de hogar; de esta manera ella espera tener su vivienda en mejores condiciones, que aseguren el bienestar y la seguridad de sus Padres, así Rosa seguirá trabajando y esforzándose por salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa is 61 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the city of Ica. She is a very happy, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has always had a strong desire to get ahead. From a very young age, Rosa has had to work to help her parents with household expenses. Therefore, she was never able to get a secondary education, but she would have liked to pursue a career as a nurse. In her free time, she likes to spend time with her parents, who are in her care, and she also likes to cook her favorite dish "arroz con pollo" (chicken and rice).

With support from her family, and with great enthusiasm and dedication, Rosa works every day at her small business, where she sells snacks and drinks. She works for approximately 10 hours every day, and believes that things are going well because she is very kind to all her customers and offers good products with a great attitude.

Rosa is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support, and hopes to use the resources from this loan to finish some repairs to her house, such as putting in a new floor and finishing painting the house. She hopes these improvements will result in a better quality of life and a more secure home for herself and her parents.

loans.use: to finish repairs and improvements on her home.

loans.name: La Buena Amistad Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú!  Les presento el grupo La Buena Amistad

Zelza de 43 años, es casada vive con sus 04 hijos y esposo, ambos trabajan para tratar de darle lo mejor a sus hijos, fue por este motivo que hace 15 años Zelsa empezó a trabajar; busco un puesto de venta en el mercadito de su zona y empezó con la venta de pollo, poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientela hasta lograr tener sus caceras quienes acuden casi a diario a su puesto a comprarle pollo. Ella se esmera por darles buena atención y venderles el producto fresco, con estos ingresos ella puede ayudar a pagar algunos gastos de su casa como el colegio de sus hijos y los servicios de agua y luz. Con el préstamo obtenido quiere seguir invirtiendo en la compra de  pollo, lo que más desea en el futuro es ser una negociante exitosa y dedicarse a la venta por mayor. Ella esta agradecida a quienes hacen posible sus préstamos y la ayudan seguir  adelante tanto a ella como a todos los miembros de su alcancía.

*Zelza es la Sra. que viste polo a rayas plomo con turquesa.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru.  Let me introduce you to the La Buena Amistad communal bank.

Zelza, age 43, is married and has four children.  She and her husband both work in order to give their children the best.  That is why Zelsa started to work 15 years ago.  She looked for a stand at the market in the area, and she started to sell chicken.

Little by little she was getting customers until she managed to have customers that go to her stand almost every day to buy chicken.  She strives to give them good service and to sell them fresh products.  With this income she is able to help pay some of the expenses for the household like school for her children and water and electrical services.

She wants to use the loan she got to buy chicken.  What she wants most of all in the future is to be a successful businesswoman and to sell wholesale.

She is grateful to those who make her loans possible.  They help her to get ahead, and they help all of the members of her communal bank.

*In the photo Zelza is wearing a striped turquoise shirt.

loans.use: to buy chicken.

loans.name: Lonah

texts.en:
Lonah is 49 years old and married with two grown-up children aged 20 years and 30 years.


She sells water to the residents of Kajiado. This is a business she has done for the last two years. With this loan, Lonah plans to buy another water tank so that she can store more water for supply.

From the proceeds, she hopes to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy another water tank for water storage.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town where he plants cash crops such as potatoes and beans. He is 52 years old, married to Jane and they have five children.

This will be his second loan amount and he plans to buy building materials and complete the construction of his house.

In the future, John hopes to grow his farming business and make more income and be able to provide good education for his children.

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa, a 70-year-old married mother of three grown children, lives with her family in Bohol, Philippines where she has had a poultry business, the source of the family's income, for more than 30 years now.

Generosa is in need of additional capital for the expansion of her business and so is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP to buy feeds for the poultry. Moreover, she will invest some of the money in a retailing business.

Generosa dreams of improving her enterprise to generate more income to finance some of the family's expenses, reinvest in her business, and save.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the poultry.

loans.name: Cheribin Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwadjuma, Présidente et promoteur du groupe de crédit Cherubin, Femme dynamique, jeune entrepreneur expérimentée et très ambitieuse, âgée de 31 ans. Elle est vendeuse de denrées alimentaires. Son mari est quincaillier. Elle a commencé son business en s’entraidant avec son mari. Plus tard, elle constitua son capital et trouva son autonomie. Elle vient de réaliser 2 cycles dans le programme de micro crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi,ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 150 kg de farine de manioc, les sels, les tomates, etc. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et accroître son chiffre d'affaire. La cliente remercie Hekima pour les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés
texts.en:
This client, Mwadjuma, is the president and promoter of the loan group Cherubin. She is 31 years old, an energetic woman, a young entrepreneur, and very ambitious. She is a seller of grocery items. Her husband sells hardware. Mwadjuma started her business with assistance from her husband. Later on, she built up her own capital fund and found autonomy. 

Mwadjuma just completed two cycles in the micro-loan program at the microfinance institution Hekma. This new loan must serve to supply her with 150 kg of cassava flour, salt, tomatoes, etc.

In addition, she would like to see her children grow up and to increase her sales. This client thanks Hekima for its actions helping poor women excluded from traditional banks to become autonomous. 

It is appropriate to note that certain clients are holding their babies.

loans.use: to buy 150 kg of cassava flour, salt, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Jakeline Jhoana

texts.es:
Les presento a Jackeline, una joven estudiante de Turismo y Hoteleria en la Universidad.
Jackeline solicito el préstamo para pagar sus pensiones y así poder continuar con sus estudios sus padres  se esfuerzan mucho para ayudarla en su propósito y su mayor deseo es verla convertida en una profesional. Ella en sus ratos libres trabaja en un gimnasio, con los ingresos que percibe puede comprar algunos libros y materiales que son indispensables para sus estudios, su mayor satisfacción será  graduarse con buenas calificaciones y trabajar en un hotel de prestigio, la carrera que ella estudia dura 5 años solo le falta uno  para terminar su carrera. Jackeline está muy emocionada por saber que personas de todo el mundo le van a apoyar en sus estudios, principalmente sin conocerla.
texts.en: This is Jackeline, a young university student who studies tourism and hospitality. She asks for this loan in order to pay her university fees and thus be able to continue in her studies. Her parents do everything in their power to help her reach her goals and their greatest wish is to see her become a professional. In her spare time, she works at a gym: with the money she earns there, she can afford some of the books and supplies she needs for her studies. Her greatest joy would be to graduate with good marks and to work in a prestigious hotel. She has been studying for five years, and needs only one more to complete her degree. Jackeline is very touched by the fact that lenders from all over the world will help her with her studies, even though they do not know her personally.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Desak Nyoman

texts.en:
Desak is a Balinese artisan specializing in the traditional art of batik. She would like to invest in the purchase of textiles and batik dyes to increase production in time for the holiday season.

Desak has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is her story:

"I learned how to make batik from another artisan in my community in 1989. When I worked with her, she taught me many things about textiles and hand-painting batik. In March of 2000, I started my own workshop. I have built my career step by step. I started by asking my neighbors to come to my place to look at my collection and place orders if they liked it. Now, there's so much to do I need the help of several assistants!"

"Thank you so much for your support through this microcredit. I hope you will like the design of my batik robes, whether it is for you or for the ones you love." 

Use the link below to view Desak's batik robes and accessories on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=2417

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of textiles and batik dyes to increase production in time for the holiday season

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 30 years old, married, and blessed with two children. She sells molasses, a business she started three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has requested a first loan  of KES. 30,000 to purchase molasses for sale. The anticipated profit will aid her to buy additional stock for her business. Her dream is to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase molasses for making animals feeds.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 34-year-old married woman with one son from Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in a sari-sari store or convenience store business for more than five years now. She sells snack foods, noodles, and canned goods among others to the people in their locality. 

Marilyn works hard to earn a living so that she can help her husband in supporting the needs of the family. Right now, Marilyn is asking for additional capital for her business. She is applying for a loan worth 7000 PHP to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store like sodas, canned goods, snack foods and the like. 

Marilyn dreams of expanding her business and making it sustainable. With this she can finally improve their way of living and experience fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store like sodas, canned goods, snack foods and the like.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva  is 45 years old, married with six children. Her eldest is 23 and her youngest is 9 years old. Eva is engaged in selling fresh fish in her town of Panglao, Bohol. This business has been running since 1989. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more fish to resell. With enough funds for her business she can increase the variety of fish, thus attracting more customers to her, for better income. Her profit will always be for her children's school fees and family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Misha

texts.en:
Misha is a farmer from Nalbandyan village. He raises cattle and cultivates onions, beans, plum trees and grapes. Misha lives with his wife and son, who help him to run the farm. 

Misha has challenges with feeding the cattle during the winter season. Thus he has applied for this loan to purchase necessary fodder: grass, bran and barley. This is important for Misha to keep on developing his farm and gathering stable income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for grass, bran and barley

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María tiene 43 años, está casada con Saturnino, de 45 años. Juntos viven en la casa que compraron gracias a los trabajos que realizan a diario durante los años que llevan de convivencia.
Ella es una mujer alegre, su labor principal es labrar la tierra para luego cultivar plantas de cacao y café. Esta actividad la realiza hace 25 años y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar en temporadas de lluvia donde los insectos son los que afectan sus plantas.  Su labor la efectúa junto a su esposo y dos jornaleros, a quienes contrata para que realicen el desyerbo y luego fertilizan sus plantas. Sus cosechas las comercializa en los centros de acopio de su localidad, quienes le remuneran muy buenas ganancias por cada kilogramo de grano de café o cacao que vende. Con el tiempo desea en seguir cultivando plantas de café, ya que tienen mayores ganancias.

Este es su crédito número 12 con MFP y se siente muy alegre por seguir obteniendo el crédito que apoya a sus planes de trabajo. En su banco comunal es una socia responsable y comparte momentos de alegría en las reuniones que realizan.
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles comprará abono orgánico para esparcir en sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Ana María is 43 years old, and is married to Saturnino, who is 45 years old. They live in their own house, which they bought with money they worked hard for during their life together.

Ana María is a happy woman who makes a living as a coffee and cacao farmer. She has been farming for 25 years, and knows that the rainy season, when insects affect the crops, is the most challenging part of the growing cycle. She works with her husband and two other day laborers whom they have contracted for help with the weeding and fertilizing of the crops. They sell their produce in the collection centers near their home, and usually receive a decent price for each kilogram of coffee or cacao that they sell to the wholesaler. Ana María hopes to continue farming coffee, since she makes the most money with that crop.

This is her twelfth loan with MFP, and she is grateful for this opportunity to invest in her work and farming operation. Ana María is a responsible member of her local community bank, and enjoys the group meetings and her role in that community. With the 1,000 nuevos soles in this loan, she plans to purchase organic manure to spread on her crops and to help with the growing process.

loans.use: to purchase organic manure to spread on her crops.

loans.name: Edwige Gbelome's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Edwige Gbelome, la responsable, est âgée de 43 ans. Mariée et mère d'un enfant scolarisé dans une école de la ville. Edwige Gbelome s'est spécialisée dans la vente des boîtes de conserve, des savons et des produits vivriers depuis 08 mois. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et sa clientèle est composée des habitants du quartier et de ses alentours. Dans le souci de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev en vue de maximiser son intérêt et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Edwige Gbelome se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en: This is a group of two people with a group loan.  Edwige Gbelome, the leader, is 43 years old.  She is married and the mother of one child who attends the school in the town.  Edwige Gbelome has been specializing in selling canned goods, soaps, and produce for eight months.   She gets her supplies at one of the markets in Bénin and her customers are residents of her neighborhood and surrounding areas.  In the hopes of increasing her turnover and to meet the demand of her customers, she has requested and gotten a new micro-loan through Finadev in order to maximize her profits and to contribute to the education of her children.  Edwige Gbelome is to the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 3 cases of milk, 1 case of sardines and 4 cases of pasta.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José es un joven de 19 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Chincha, a pesar de su corta edad él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias al apoyo de sus padres José se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de Mecánica Automotriz, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día José trabaja como ayudante de mecánica en una empresa de repuestos y servicios generales de vehículos, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana José asiste a su centro de trabajo, el labora un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
José se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir sus gastos de estudios, tales como: matrícula, mensualidades, libros y materiales de escritorio; de esta manera José podrá seguir cursando sus estudios profesionales y seguirá esforzándose para lograr ser un buen profesional y un hombre de bien.
texts.en:
Jose is a single youth of 19, and lives with his parents and siblings in the city of Chincha. Despite his young age, he is a very good, hard working and enthusiastic person with the desire to get ahead. Thanks to his parents help, Jose is studying to be an auto mechanic. In his free time he is dedicated to reading and on some occasions, he cooks a rich Chaufa Rice dish which he shares with his family.

With much effort and enthusiasm, day after day, Jose works as a mechanic's assistant in an enterprise that repairs and performs general services on vehicles. Every day from the earliest hours of the morning, Jose is at his work center. He works approximately 8 hours a day and thinks things are going well, due to his efforts and his kind treatment of offers.

Jose is very grateful to Kiva investors, since thanks to their help, he can cover the costs of his studies: matriculation, monthly fees, books and writing materials. In this manner, Jose will be able to continue pursuing his professional studies and forging ahead to become a good professional and an accomplished person.

loans.use: to cover the costs of his professional training.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Glyza

texts.en: For six years now, Glyza has been engaged in the business of making and selling calamay (a sticky sweet delicacy made of coconut milk, brown sugar and ground glutinous rice, packaged inside an empty coconut shell). This is how she provides for the needs of her two children, who are ages 5 and 7. She is asking for a loan to buy brown sugar, plastic bags, coconut milk and glutinous rice. Glyza's income from this loan will help her meet the needs of her family, especially her children, who need to pay school fees. In the future, she would like to increase her production and accept more orders so that she can earn more profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy brown sugar, plastic bags, coconut milk and glutinous rice.

loans.name: Philomene

texts.fr: philomène est une jeune femme de 33 ans fiancée, mère de de 03 enfants dont l'age varie entre 12 et 17 ans, tous vont à l'école. En plus de celà, elle a deux autres personnes à sa charge. Elle est commerçante et a ouvert un bar dans un quartier de la capitale qu'elle gère depuis 8 ans. Grace à son chaleureux acceuil, et à, son expérience dans ce domaine, elle a conquis et fidélisé une clientèle au fil du temps. La croissance continuelle de sa clientèle et la petitesse de son capital rendent l'offre inférieure à la demande, ce pousse parfois une partie de sa clientèle à se tourner vers la concurrence d'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité. Ce crédit lui permettra d'augmenter non seulement son stock de boissons (40 casiers), mais également de satisfaire et surtout de recuperer sa clientèle. Ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Philomène économisera une partie de ces bénéfices pour la scolarité de ses enfants et elle réinvestira l'autre dans son activité parce qu'elle aimera ouvrir un dépôt de boisson dans un futur proche.
texts.en:
Philomène is a young woman, 33 years old, engaged to be married, and the mother of three children, 12 to 17 years old. In addition, she has two other persons to support. She is a merchant and opened a bar in a district in the capital that she has been running for eight years. Thanks to her warm welcomes and her experience in this domain, she won over a loyal customer base over the course of time.

The continual growth of her customer base and her meager capital means her supplies are less than the demand. This sometimes pushes some of her customers toward the competition, thus the importance of this loan for her business. 

This loan will enable her to increase not only her stock of beverages (40 cases) but also to satisfy her customers and particularly to bring them back. This will increase her sales and therefore her profit margins. 

Philomène will save part of her profits for her children's education, and she will invest the other part in her business because she would like to open a warehouse for beverages in the near future.

loans.use: to buy 40 cases of beverages

loans.name: Yesu Anaweza Group

texts.fr: La cliente Beatrice est présidente du groupe de crédit Yesu Anaweza, âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous. Son mari est un ingénier informaticien. La cliente est propriétaire d’une boutique et fait le commerce général. Elle commença avec  le crédit de Hekima. Elle vient de réaliser 3 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit. Le défi majeur pour elle, est la petitesse du capital. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  25 kg de riz, 5kg d’Omo, 25 kg de sucre, sels, etc.  Elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise. Ainsi elle remercie Hekima pour songer aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: This client, Beatrice, is the president of the loan group Yesu Anaweza. She is 34 years old, married, and the mother of six children, who are all in school. Her husband is a software engineer. This client is the owner of a store and works in general commerce. She started with a Hekima loan. She just completed three cycles in the micro-loan program. The major challenge for her is meager capital. This new loan must serve to supply her with 25 kg of rice, 5 kg of Omo, 25 kg of sugar, salt, etc. She would like to grow her enterprise. So she thanks Hekima for thinking about small-scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 25 kg of rice, 5 kg of Omo, 25 kg of sugar, salt, etc.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila tiene 42 años, está casada con Clemente, de 50 años. Ellos viven en la casa que compraron gracias a sus esfuerzos que día a día realizan para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Ella tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende comestibles y otros productos para el hogar. Esta labor la empezó hace 2 años y comenta que gracias a su trabajo puede tener un solvento para su hogar. Ella realiza las ventas sola y a veces cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien más tiempo está en la chacra viendo su producción de cacao y café. Lo que le resulta incómodo es cuando su tienda queda casi vacía y debe de abastecer su tienda, por ello acude a los préstamos para seguir mejorando en su negocio.

Este es su crédito número 18 con MFP y se siente contenta por contar una vez más con esta oportunidad, ya que de esa manera podrá abastecer su negocio. Asimismo, se siente cómoda de trabajar con socios que apoyan en sus planes de trabajo.
Con estos 1,500 nuevos soles comprará productos de limpieza (detergentes, lejía, jabón) y abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, menestras, etc.) para su tienda.
texts.en:
Cirila, 42, is married to Clemente, 50.  They live in the house they bought thanks to their day-to-day efforts to improve their quality of life.

She has a small grocery store, where she sells food and other household products.  She started this business two years ago and is debt-free, thanks to her hard work.  She works alone or sometimes her husband helps her, but he is more often in the fields taking care of the cocoa and coffee crops.  She does not like it when her shop is almost empty of stock and she needs to supply it, and so she gets loans to help her improve her business.

This is her eighteenth credit with Kiva partner MFP.  She is happy to have this opportunity once again, as it enables her to keep her business adequately supplied.  She feels comfortable working with the members of MFP,  who help her with her plans for her business.

She will use the 1,500 soles ($575) to buy cleaning products (detergents, bleach, soap) and groceries (rice, sugar, vegetables, etc.) for her shop.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products (detergent, bleach, soap) and groceries (rice, sugar, vegetables, etc.) for her shop.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina es una joven de 21 años, su pareja es David, de 24 años. Viven en la casa que sus padres le heredaron y  ahora se esmeran por darle una mejor vida a su pequeño hijo Luis de 3 años. 
Cada día, Dina se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno y luego dirigirse a sus campos de cultivo, junto a su esposo, quien se encarga se mantener fértiles sus plantas de cacao, café y hoja de coca. Esta labor la lleva realizando hace 4 años en terrenos propios y comenta que las cosechas que realiza por temporadas de cualquier planta de su cultivo las lleva a comercializar a los centros de acopio de su localidad, quienes le gratifican a muy buenos precios. De todo lo que produce prefiere el café porque es lo que mayor ingreso lo provee.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se siente contenta de contar con la ayuda de las personas que apoyan sus planes de trabajo. En su banco comunal es una socia responsable con sus cuotas de pago.
Con este préstamo, más dinero ahorrado, podrá comprar otro terreno para seguir cultivando plantas de café.
texts.en:
Dina is a young 21 year old woman. Her husband is David, who is 24 years old. They lives in the house she inherited from her parents and now they work hard to give a better life to Luis, their 3 year old son.
 
Every day, Dina gets up very early to make breakfast and later go to her crops, with her husband, and they take care of keeping the cacao, coffee, and coca plants fertile. She has been doing this for 4 years on her own land and she remarks that she grows her crops seasonally according the plants. She takes them to market in the local stockpiling center, where they give her a very good price. Of all the things she grows she prefers coffee because it brings in the most income.

This is her second loan with MFP and she is happy to have the help of people who support her work plans. She is a responsible member with the payments in her communal bank  With this loan, plus savings, she will be able to buy another plot of land to keep growing coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy another plot of land to keep growing coffee plants.

loans.name: Look To God Group

texts.en: Members of the “Look To God” loan group are requesting a second loan from SMT/Kiva lenders. As a result of their good repayment record, an SMT loan officer has decided to increase their loan amount. They are requesting a loan for 2,900,000 Leones for the entire group. Previous SMT/Kiva loans made a huge impact on their lives and businesses, which they were able to expand, so that their sales and profit margin also increased. Out of the profits they made, they were able to successfully repay their loan, feed their children, send them to school, etc. With this new loan, they will once again buy more goods to sell from their respective businesses, and this will further increase their business capital and income and allow them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to their customers.

loans.name: Mesalina

texts.en: Mesalina lives in the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She is 59 years old, married and has two adult children. To make a living, she operates a store where she sells accessories, mostly for women. She started this business a long time ago as her sole source of income. Mesalina is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of hair clips, combs, head bands and other items. These are the products that will appeal the most to women, specially teenagers. She will use the additional income she earns to improve her family's living standards and continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of hair clips, combs, head bands and other items

loans.name: Némè

texts.fr: Némè a 44 ans, elle habite à Lomé avec son mari et ses 5 enfants. Ses enfants sont âgés de 13 à 29, seuls deux d'entre eux sont encore scolarisés. Le mari de Némè est militaire. Elle exerce depuis l'année dernière la profession de revendeuse. Elle vend toutes sortes d'objet en plastique sur un étalage. Némè son souhait est d'acheter d'avantage d'objets en plastique afin d'agrandir son activité. C'est pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit dans notre institution. Elle espère que les profits qu'elle réalisera lui permettront de diversifier sa marchandise et d'ouvrir une boutique. Sa priorité reste cependant d'assurer les besoins primaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
Némè is 44 years old. She lives in Lomé with her husband and five children. Her children are from 13 to 29 years old, and only two of them are still in school. Her husband is a soldier. She has been a retailer by trade since last years. She sells all sorts of plasticware on display. 

Némè's wish is to buy more plasticware to expand her business. To do so, she is requesting a loan from our institution. She hopes that the profits she will earn will enable her to diversify her merchandise and to open a store. Yet her priority is still to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: to buy plasticware

loans.name: Binapani Group

texts.en:
In the year 2010, Gouri of Muniguda village of Rayagaga district in Odisha formed a group with three other women of her locality named Binapani (name of a local Hindu goddess) with the intervention of Mahashakti Foundation. The lady standing at the extreme left raising her hand in the photo is Gouri.
She is 28 years old, living with her husband, her son aged 8, and her daughter aged 6. She belongs to a Below Poverty Line family (BPL), a segment living on less than a dollar a day. Her husband does multiple jobs--from being a tractor driver to a daily wage labor in the paddy fields. His was the only source of income for their family until Gouri decided to step up and share the burden with her husband. 

Gouri started her leaf plate business in 2004 on a small scale under these compelling circumstances and has been working hard to grow her business. She makes plates woven out of dry leaves at her house and local traders in the village come and collect them every week. She makes 1000-1500 plates each week. These plates are biodegradable, disposable, hygienic, and an inexpensive alternative to modern paper or plastic utensils. These are widely used by local food stalls and hotels to serve food.

She gets her supply of leaves and bamboo twigs used for stitching from local sellers in the market and sun-dries them for two days to make them ready to be stitched. Presently, the stock she buys from the local sellers is enough for her to make plates for one day and sell the next day. She wants to have enough stock to support her business during the monsoon as well when she cannot get dry leaves. A portion of the loan will be utilized by her to buy more stock of leaves and bamboo twigs. 

Gouri also wants to buy a buffalo for milking and sell the milk to local hotels and tea stalls. This is the third loan for Gouri and she promises to repay on time. Gouri dreams of building a small concrete house for her family and giving a proper education to her children. Gouri says, “By successful management of my loans, I have gained more confidence in myself, and I hope that I can do even better to support my family in future.”

The other three members of the group, Sakuntala, Dhire and Kuntala, are also doing the same business as Gouri and are very much excited to expand their business by increasing the volume of their leaf plate making.

loans.use: To buy more leaves for her leaf plate business and buy a buffalo to start her milk business

loans.name: Gruhalaxmi Group

texts.en:
In the year 2010 a group of five active women of Muniguda village of Rayagada district in Odisha, India came out with a new objective to contribute to their family income and formed a group named Gruhalaxmi (the name of a Hindu goddess who is believed to bring wealth to the family). Sanjulata is one of them. The lady to the extreme right raising her hand in the photo is Sanjulata.

She is 42 years old, living with her husband and one son aged 24. Her husband is a carpenter. He makes wooden furniture and sells to a local furniture shop. Her son also helps in this business. She started a leaf plate business to supplement her husband’s income with the help of a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. She makes plates woven out of dry leaves at her house, stitching them together with the help of bamboo twigs. These plates are biodegradable, disposable, hygienic, and an inexpensive alternative to modern paper or plastic utensils. These are widely used by local food stalls and hotels to serve food. She earns Rs.1,500/- to Rs. 2,000/- per month from this business. Sanjulata was able to get her daughter married into a good family out of the family income. This gave her encouragement and confidence.

She is planning to make leaf plates on a larger scale and sell to the local shops in her village. A portion of the loan will be utilized by her to buy more stock of raw materials like leaves and bamboo twigs for her leaf plate business. She also wants to contribute to her husband’s business and plans to invest some in purchasing raw materials like plywood, gum and machines, etc. for the carpentry business. This will give enough work for her husband and son, simultaneously increasing the revenue from her business as well as her husband’s business.

Sanjulata would like to open a furniture shop in the market of Muniguda town and construct a toilet in her house for better sanitation. She also wants to save enough this year to find a suitable girl for her son to get him married.

loans.use: To buy more stock of raw materials like leaves and bamboo twigs for her leaf plate business

loans.name: Maa Bhagabati Group

texts.en:
This group’s name is Maa Bhagabati (name of a local deity) formed in the year 2009. Its five members are all women from the Rayagada district in Odisha, India. Rayagada is a tribal district of Odisha where 85% of the population is rural and 65% of them belong to the BPL (Below Poverty Line) category. People from the BPL category live on less than one dollar a day. 

Among the members, Kuni is the most active person. The lady raising her hand in the photo is Kuni. She is 45 years old. She has been running a grocery store with the help of her husband for the last 10 years. She sells daily household items like rice, sugar, oil, soap, spices, biscuits etc. in her village. She initially started a leaf plate business in her house and grew to owning a grocery shop. Her husband helps her in running the grocery shop. She is always looking for growth and now wants to grow her retail shop into a wholesale shop. A portion of the loan will be utilized by her to buy a huge stock of items such as rice, sugar, spices, etc., of whatever she is selling, to make it into a wholesale shop.
 
She also wants to simultaneously increase the volume of her leaf plate business. She says there is a lot of demand for these plates during the monsoon season and wants to buy more stock of raw materials to store enough finished plates for the high demand season. Some of her loan will be utilized by her to buy more stock of raw materials like leaves and bamboo twigs. The beauty in this group is that she buys finished leaf plates from the other members of the group who also make leaf plates. These plates are biodegradable, disposable, hygienic, and an inexpensive alternative to modern paper or plastic utensils. These are widely used by local food stalls and hotels to serve food.

loans.use: To buy more stock of items like rice, spices, etc. for her grocery shop and expand her retail shop into a wholesale business

loans.name: Ganga Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ganga. It was formed in the year 2010. Its four members are all women from the town called Muniguda. It is located in the district of Rayagada, one of the poorest districts in India.

One of the members of this group is Laxmi. The lady sitting second from left raising her hand in the photo is Laxmi. She is the Group Leader. She is 26 years old, living with her husband, her daughter aged 7 and her son aged 3. She has been involved in the leaf plate business for the last 15 years. She makes plates woven out of dry leaves at her house and local traders in the village come and collect them every week. She makes 1000-1500 plates in a week. These plates are biodegradable, disposable, hygienic, and an inexpensive alternative to modern paper or plastic utensils. These are widely used by local food stalls and hotels to serve food.

Laxmi gets the supply of the leaves and bamboo twigs used for stitching from the local sellers in the market and sun-dries them for two days to make them ready to be stitched. Presently, the stock she buys from the local sellers is enough for her to make leaves for one day and sell the next day. She wants to have enough stock to support her business during the monsoon as well when she cannot get dry leaves. A portion of the loan will be utilized by her to buy more stock of leaves and bamboo twigs. 

Laxmi also wants to buy a buffalo for milking and sell the milk to local hotels and tea stalls. She believes her established contacts with hotels and food stalls through her existing business will make it easier for her to sell the milk. This additional income will supplement her income during bad weather times where it might be difficult to dry leaves. Laxmi dreams of building a small concrete house for her family and giving a proper education to her children.

The other three members of her group are Bhagya, Tulasa and Amika; they are also doing the same business as Laxmi. Since the formation of Ganga, all members of the group have been working hard and continue to work with unity, honesty and sincerity under the leadership of Laxmi.
