This is 52-year-old Susan. She is married and has three children ages 25, 20, and 18 years. She has two nieces who live with her and she takes care of them.

In 2009, Susan established her provision and drinks business. She began her business to earn a living. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 Sierra Leone Leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

Susan would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Susan requires the loan in order to buy provisions worth 3,000,000 SLL. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 450,000 SLL. In the future, Susan plans to expand the shop and employ an assistant sale person. Dedicated and hardworking, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy provisions worth 3,000,000 SLL.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 39 years old. She is married and has three children. She runs a sari-sari store where she sells snacks, biscuits, soft drinks, and spices. She has been in this business for 4 years and has requested a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase additional goods to stock in her store, such as eggs, cooking oil, noodles, juice, and detergent. 

Estrella works hard to provide for her family. This is the only source of income she had because she was not be able to finish her college education. So, she is proving to her family that she is worth it.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to stock in her store such as eggs, cooking oil, noodles, juice, and detergent.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a resident of Nyamira. She is married and has been practicing mixed farming for the last seven years.  The core products of her farms are milk, maize, and fruits, especially mangoes. She is 33 years old.

Jane has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She is optimistic that she will earn more with the acquisition of the loan and improve her living standards and farming business. She plans to have at least three dairy cows.

However, she says rampant animal diseases remain the main challenge.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sokkhoeun's Group

texts.en:
Sokkhoeun is 35 years old and married. She has three children who are dependent on her and all of them are still in school in a rural area located in the Prey Chhor district of Cambodia. Rice farming is the main source of her family's income. She has been in this business for several years, earning about 16,900 KHR per day to spend for daily expenses. She manages to save about 7,000 KHR each day. 

Sokkhoeun's group consists of four members who are all female. She and two other members are taking their third loans while the other member is taking her first loan with VisionFund. The past loans from VisionFund have helped her family afford to save some money and have a decent house to live in. Now requesting a loan, Sokhhoeun, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her rice paddy and to pay for labor. She hopes to grow healthy rice to sell for a good price to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her rice paddy

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a mother of four children aged between 16 years and 6 months. She is a farmer in her rural home in Kitale, Western Kenya with 7 years of experience in mixed farming, with her major produce being milk and maize for the local market.

Gladys has requested a loan of 41,600 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. This is her second loan with Juhudi Kilimo after the first one of 20,000 KES. Her plan is to have a farm of at least three dairy cows and a good number of birds. She adds that this will ensure that the family gets adequate income from the sale of milk for consumption.

She notes animal diseases as the major challenge in farming.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a farmer and a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya, where she has practiced mixed farming for nine solid years with maize and dairy being the main produce she sells to the local market to provide income to meet her family's needs.

Violet's loan request of 41,600 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo will help her buy and insure a dairy cow. She will use the income to repay the loan and provide the family with basic needs. Her plan is to acquire more land to give room for a major farming expansion.

She says pests, high cost of farm inputs, and unreliable rains are her major challenges.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
A farmer in Kitale with 15 solid years of experience, Andrew's produce includes milk, poultry and horticultural goods. He notes that the major costs incurred in animal feeds, especially during dry seasons, detract from farming profits.

Andrew has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says this loan will enable him to improve the quality of his dairy cows and thereby increase family income through better production.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is a father of three children aged between 12 and 6 years, and are all schooling. He is aged 32 and has six solid years in mixed farming with dairy, poultry, and maize farming being the key areas. He has no other source of income to meet his family’s needs. 

Meshack has made a loan request of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him boost his poultry farming business. He is optimistic that the skills he has acquired in the six years in farming will make him reap the best returns from the loans. He wants to specialize in rearing broilers.

He mentions inadequate capital as the main challenge in the farming business.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya.  She is 38 years old and married with two children, aged ten and thirteen years. She has five years in active farming with maize, milk, and poultry being the main products she delivers to the local markets.

Sarah has made a loan request amounting to 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to buy and insure a dairy cow. Her main focus is to make dairy farming her core business with a farm of ten dairy cows at one time. She believes she will be able to enjoy the economies of scale with time and acquire a better capital base for future business and farming expansions.

Sarah notes fluctuation in market prices and the high cost of inputs as her major challenges.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been in farming for eight straight years in her rural home of Kitale, Western Kenya. She also runs a salon to supplement her farming income. She says these two businesses are the source of livelihood for her family of three children, who are between the ages of 3 and 15.

Mary has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi KIlimo to buy poultry birds. She says this will boost her poultry farming and help her fully utilize the skills she has acquired during the eight years of her active involvement in farming.

However, she notes that diseases, especially poultry diseases, remain a major challenge that requires skill in order to manage potential outbreaks and deaths.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya, where he lives with his family of five children all being of school going ages. He has been in farming for five years, with dairy and poultry farming being his key businesses.

Daniel has requested a loan of 31,200 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says this will provide adequate milk for family use as well as provide additional income to meet other basic needs.

Daniel says animal diseases are the main challenge in farming but appreciates the loan services and training by Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is age 59 and has been in active farming business for 15 years without interruption in her rural home in Kitale area of Western Kenya. Her farm currently produces milk, maize, and beans, which she sells to the local market to help her meet her family's basic needs.

Immaculate has made a loan request of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to help her venture into poultry farming. She says that the diversification of her farming business will generate more income to meet her family's basic needs and more specifically take care of her orphaned grandchildren.

Immaculate is glad for Juhudi Kilimo loan services.

loans.use: to begin poultry farming.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Saludos desde Perú! Les presento el Grupo Las Emprendedoras

Gloria vende productos de belleza, este negocio lo inicio para ayudar a su esposo y aportar algo de dinero para los gastos de la casa, los productos que ofrece son muy requeridos por sus vecinas y amigas, en su mayoría le piden perfumes, talcos, cremas y maquillaje en general. A este trabajo le dedica los días de semana, los sábados y domingos Gloria se dedica a la venta de tamales ella aprendió a preparar tamales  preguntando a vendedoras del lugar donde reside, actualmente vende  alrededor de 100 tamales que ella misma sale a repartir  a sus clientes  a quienes les encanta y son sus fieles consumidores, el Sueño de Gloria es tener su propio restaurante y que sus ingresos sean suficientes  para lograr que sus 02 hijos terminen la escuela y se conviertan en profesionales. El préstamo obtenido por medio de la alcancía “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS” lo utilizara para la compra de panca, maíz, etc que son los insumos utilizados para la preparación de sus tamales, dentro de la alcancía tiene el cargo de secretaria, ella está muy agradecida por el apoyo que recibe para su negocio.
 
Gloria esta  sentada viste chompa azulina y pantalón fucsia,en la foto también aparece una socia pasiva.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru, Here the Grupo Las Emprendedoras is presented. 

Gloria sells beauty products. She began this business to help her husband and contribute some money to the household expenses. The products that she offers are very necessary for her neighbors and friends. For the most part they request perfumes, powders, creams and general make up. She works in this business during the week. On Saturdays and Sundays she sells tamales which she learned to prepare by asking the vendors where she lives. She currently sells about 100 tamales that she goes out to sell to her customers, whom adore her and are loyal customers. 

Gloria's dream is to have her own restaurant and to have sufficient income so that her two children finish school and become working professionals. The loan she received through the communal bank Las Emprendedoras will be used to buy supplies for her tamales. Within the communal bank she is the Secretary and is very thankful for the support that she receives for her business.

Gloria is shown wearing a blue sweater and fuchsia pants. The photo also shows an inactive member.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the preparation of tamales.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a father of two children, aged ten and below two years. He has been in farming for seven years. He sells his produce, which mainly includes maize, poultry, and horticultural products, to the local market to earn income that meets the family’s basic needs.

Benard has made a loan request for 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the income will help in providing education fees and basic needs to the children. He plans to expand his farming with dairy cows to ten in number.

He says fluctuation of market prices, drought, and the high cost of production are challenges.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is married and has five children between the ages of three months and eleven years, with the three oldest already in school.

Martin has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to help him buy and insure a dairy cow. He says he will buy a better breed of cow with the loan in order to increase his milk production. He aspires to own a farm with at least five dairy cows. He says the proceeds will be channeled to educating his children.

He mentions the high cost of farming inputs and a lack of capital as his main challenges.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en:
Bahar is a 52-year-old woman who is married and has five children. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with her family in an IDP settlement. She is a very hardworking and kind woman. She is a cattle breeder and breeds cows and cattle for milk and meat purposes. She has 15 years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced farmer with a deep knowledge of the market and her customers' needs.

Bahar makes homemade yoghurt and sells it, as well as fresh milk, to her neighbors and local vendors. She also raises cattle for meat purpose and sells to the butchers in the settlement. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Her monthly income is 150 AZN. Her husband is also working; however his income as a workman is too low to cover the family's needs.

To increase her income and improve her financial situation she applied for loan of 1500 AZN. She is going to buy two cattle and one milking cow. This will be her third loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy two cattle and one milking cow.

loans.name: Grupo Empresarial Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! Les presento al Grupo Empresarial.

Carlos, es uno de sus miembros él tiene 20 años es soltero y muy trabajador. El se dedica al transporte público, con mucho esfuerzo pudo comprarse un moto taxi, ya son 02 años que tiene trabajando con su propia moto, antes era muy difícil  porque tenía que alquilarla y esto le dejaba menores ingresos que no eran suficientes para aportar en su casa, ahora las cosas han cambiado al ser dueño de su propia moto puede   ayudar a sus padres con los gastos familiares y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Carlos va a utilizar su préstamo para reparar su moto y darle mantenimiento. Más  adelante esta deseoso de comprarse un carro para brindar servicio de taxi. El está muy contento de saber que muchas personas lo van a apoyar en su deseo y agradece el apoyo al grupo comunal al que pertenece.

Carlos aparece en la foto con polo turquesa sin mangas.
texts.en:
Hello from Peru!  Let me introduce you to the Business Group.

Carlos is one of the members.  He is 20-years-old, single, and very hard-working.  He works in public transportation and with great effort was able to buy himself a motorcycle taxi.  He has now been working with his own taxi for two years.  Before it was very difficult because he had to rent one, which left him with lower income which wasn't sufficient to provide for his home.  Now things have changes because with his own motorcycle taxi he can help his parents with the family's expenses and have a more comfortable life.  Carlos will use his loan to repair his motorcycle and give it maintenance.  Also, in the future he hopes to buy himself a car to offer taxi service.  He is very happy to know that many people will support him with his dream and is thankful for the support of the communal group he belongs to.

Carlos appears in the photo in a turquoise shirt with no sleeves.

loans.use: to do repair and maintenance on his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Husniyya

texts.en:
Husniyya is a 24-year-old woman who raises and sells seasonal vegetables from her garden. She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with her husband and two children in the IDP Settlement. She usually raises tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes, carrots, and pumpkins.

People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made from vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in an Azerbaijan family, and also are used to make fresh punch. 

Husniyya’s monthly income is 150 AZN, and this is only one financial income. Her husband helps her to run the business. 

She applied for 1,000 AZN to purchase seeds and fertilizers and increase her monthly turnover.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry is a mother of three children with the first one being eight years old and the last one being eight months old. She has been in farming in her rural home in Kitale, Western Kenya for three years with maize and milk being her main production for the local market. She currently runs her farm with the help of one farmhand. She operates a small retail shop business for additional income.

Terry has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds at 30,000 KES and construct a dairy unit at 30,000 KES. She believes she will generate enough income to repay the loan and meet her family's basic needs. Her future plan is to acquire bigger loans from Juhudi Kilimo for better assets.

She mentions fluctuations in market prices and animal diseases as her major challenges.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of garri and palm oil

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is 34-year-old Fatmata. She is married, and has two children who are 10 and 5 years old. She has two additional dependents living with her and attending school.  In 1997, Fatmata established her kitchen utensils business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband in running the home. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy more stock. In the future, Fatmata plans to develop her business to a wholesale business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for provisions, toiletries and drinks

loans.name: Magloria

texts.es:
Magloria tiene 40 años, ella es una mujer muy laboriosa, está casada con Melaneo, de 45 años, y tienen dos hijos. 
Como pareja, se dedican a la agricultura. Todas las mañanas trabajan en sus tierras, ya que saben que del cuidado que le brinden a sus sembríos de cacao, café, hoja de coca y raíces de barbasco, dependerá la calidad y el precio que obtengan por las sociedades recolectoras. Realizan esta actividad desde hace 20 años y a veces considera difícil tener que laborar en temporada de lluvia, ya que las plagas aquejan la buena producción de sus cultivos. Para más adelante espera sembrar más plantas de cacao, ya que cuenta con espacios sin cultivar.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente contenta por contar con el préstamo. De esa manera, se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago y no quedar mal con su banco comunal.
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles contratará a peones para que le apoyen a mantener limpia su parcela.
texts.en:
Magloria, 40, is a very hard-working woman.  She is married to Melaneo, 45, and they have two children.
The couple are farmers and every morning they work in their fields.  They know that the care they give their cacao, coffee, coca leaves, and  barbasco root (an indigenous root of the Amazon) crops, will  affect the quality and the prices that the receive from the collection groups.  They have been farming for 20 years and sometimes it’s difficult to work in the rainy season. That is when infestations afflict the good crop production.  In the  future they would like to have more cacao plants since they have empty spaces in their fields.

This is her first loan with MFP and she feels content that she can count on the loan.  She promises to be punctual with her repayments so as not to have a bad reputation with the communal bank.

She will use the 1,000 new sols to hire farmhands to help her keep her fields weeded.

loans.use: to hire farmhands to keep her fields weeded

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en:
Eng is 50 years old and is living in a rural village in Dambe district. She has four children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. To make a living, Eng and her husband have been farming rice and planting cassavas for several years. With her current business, she can earn about 17,000 KHR per day to meet daily expenses and is able to save about 8,000 KHR each day. 

Eng's group consists of four members who live in the same village.  She and other two members are second-cycle clients, while the others are just with VisionFund this loan cycle. The first loan that she completely paid back to VisionFund has helped her improve her family's livelihood. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan.  Eng is going to use her portion to buy pesticides to protect her rice crops and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to make more rice so as to increase her family's income so they can afford to have a bigger house in the future.

loans.use: buy pesticides for her rice farm

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora has managed her sari-sari store business for almost nine years. She is 37 years old and married to Mardy. 

She and her husband are helping each other to acquire income. Nora currently spends her income on her children’s basic necessities in schooling. She would like to increase her profit in order to develop their living situation as well as her business. 

To achieve her dream, she is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to be used to buy grocery items such as sugar, coffee, cooking oil, and soft drinks. She hopes that she will get her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as sugar, coffee, cooking oil, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Mark.  He is married and has 3 children aged 2, 6 and 11. He has 3 additional dependents who live with him to help his younger brothers and sister with their education.

In 2010, Mark established his building materials business. The business is an expansion of the earlier business of selling patent drugs so he can add to the income of the family. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 3,770,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Mark has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans and now requires a new loan in order to improve on the sale of emulsion paints. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 565,500 SLL.

In the future, Mark plans to improve on the shop and expand to the sale of imported cement and roofing nails. The loan can improve the stock and create room for more profit.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for building materials

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad is a 28-year-old married man. He lives with his family in an internally displaced persons (IDP) settlement, as he is an IDP. Elshad raises seasonal fruits and vegetables such as corn, cucumber, tomatoes, apples, pears, peaches, plums, and cherries. He has two years of experience, but in spite of the short period he has been in this business, he has gained respect from local vendors because he produces a good organic crop without chemical fertilizers.
 
People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every Azerbaijani family's table and also used to make fresh punch.

Elshad sells his crop from his yard and sometimes takes it to the local bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN and he would like to expand his business and purchase more seeds and fertilizers to improve the quality of his crops to increase his sales. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1500 AZN. This will be his second loan and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 45-year-old woman. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives with her family in an IDP settlement. She is married and has three daughters. She raises seasonal fruits and vegetables such as pomegranates, queen-apples, pears, and cherries. In the summer she raises fruits and in the autumn and winter she raises vegetables such as potatoes, pumpkins, and carrots. 

Shahnaz's monthly income is 150 AZN. She usually sells her crops to the local market vendors. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes, like pilau and dolma, are made with vegetables. Fresh fruits are served on every Azerbaijani family's table and also used to make fresh punch. Shahnaz's daughters help her a lot in raising her crops.

Shahnaz applied for a loan of 1500 AZN to buy more seeds and fertilizers. This will be her fourth loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 34 años, está casada con Cirilo, con quien tiene un hijo.
Gracias a la agricultura pudo construir la casa donde ahora viven; “aunque es de material rústico, es mi propia casa”, comenta. Siembra maíz, papa, alverja y otros tubérculos, los que fertiliza constantemente, pues depende de su cuidado para que las plagas no los malogren. Su dedicación logra que en cada cosecha obtenga buenos resultados en la comercialización de sus productos en las diferentes ciudades donde los vende. Durante el periodo de crecimiento trabaja sola, pero ya en la cosecha contrata peones para que le ayuden en la extracción.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Productores Huallhua” y este es su crédito número 8 con MFP. Promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas y menciona que le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque todos se ayudan entre sí.
Esta vez, Vilma invertirá en la compra de 200 sacos de fertilizantes naturales para su siembra de maíz.
texts.en:
Vilma is 34 years old, and is married to Cirilo. Together they have one son, and were able to build the house they live in as a result of their hard work in farming and agriculture. "Even though it is built from poor materials, it's my own house," Vilma says. Vilma makes a living farming corn, potatoes, peas and other crops, and is always tending them with fertilizer and giving them attention so that pests do not damage them. Through much hard work, Vilma is able to get a good price for the goods she sells in several cities around her region. In the early stages of the growing cycle, Vilma works alone tending her crops. When harvest time arrives, however, she contracts help assist in picking the produce.

Vilma is a member of the community bank "Productores Huallhua," and this is her eighth loan with MFP. She promises to continue her record of prompt loan payments, and mentions that she enjoys being a member of the community bank group as it is a supportive community. Vilma plans to use the support from this loan to purchase 200 sacks of natural fertilizers for spreading on her corn crops.

loans.use: to purchase 200 sacks of natural fertilizers for her corn crops.

loans.name: Margarette

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Margaret.  She is married and has 3 children aged 3, 5 and 12. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her to help with the house chores and to help a brother with his education.

In 1995, Margaret established her textiles business. The business started to be self reliant and assist her husband in running the home. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 2,158,000 SLL every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Margaret has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans and now requires a new loan in order to improve on the trade of Ghana batik. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 625,820 SLL.

In the future, Margaret plans to expand the business to the other part of town. Since the stall is makeshift, business is disturbed when it rains.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for textiles

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela tiene 37 años, vive en la casa que compró  junto a su esposo Carlos, de 47años, y  con sus dos hijos, quienes la inspiran para seguir trabajando arduamente.
Sus cultivos son de cacao y hoja de coca. Mariela y Carlos vienen labrando sus tierras hace 24 años, en los tiempos de cosecha contratan a peones para realizar el proceso más rápido y para trasladar sus productos a los centros de acopio. A ella le gusta lo que hace porque gracias a sus ello pudo adquirir más terrenos para seguir cultivando y mejorar su situación económica.

Este es su crédito número 20 con MFP, hace más de 8 años que conoció de esta microfinanciera, por lo que se siente muy contenta de contar con este apoyo, por lo que está dispuesta a devolver puntualmente los pagos programados.
Con estos 3,000 nuevos soles contratará a jornaleros para que le ayuden a realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos, con el resto comprará abono para fertilizar sus plantas.
texts.en:
Mariela is 37 years old. She lives in the house she bought, together with her husband Carlos, 47, and her two children, who inspire her to continue working hard.

Her crops are cacao and coca leaves. Mariela and Carlos have been working their land for 24 years.  At harvest times, they hire laborers to carry out the process more rapidly, and to transport their products to the collection centers.  

She likes what she does; because thanks to it she has been able to acquire more land, so that that she can continue farming and improve her financial situation.

This is her 20th loan with MFP. It is more than eight years since she became acquainted with this microfinance institution, so she feels very happy to have this new support. Therefore she is ready to make the scheduled payments on time.

With these 3,000 nuevos soles, she will hire day laborers to help her maintain her crops. With the remainder she will buy manure for fertilizing her plantings.

loans.use: To hire day laborers to help her maintain her crops. With the remainder, she will buy manure for fertilizing her plantings.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is thankful because she has been able to manage her business buying and selling vegetables for over 18 years. She is 46 years of age and married to Rey. They were blessed with four responsible children. Aside from vegetable vending, Gloria also makes bags, coin purses, souvenirs and wallets out of bead. It is her additional source of income.

She is facing insufficient capital from her businesses because of the high tuition fees of her children. With this situation, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy vegetables such as carrots, cabbages and beans as well as beads for her souvenir making business. Gloria hopes that her loan request will be approved.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as carrots, cabbages and beans as well as beads for her souvenir making business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou, aged 36, has a store where she sells groceries, vegetables and other products. She needs the loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more goods like eggs, rice, fish paste, soy sauce and spices to stock her store. Marilou is working so hard to provide a good living to her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods like eggs, rice, fish paste, soy sauce and spices

loans.name: Twisungane/ Rhng Mrm Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel fait partie du groupe Twisungane / Rhng. Le nom du groupe signifie «se soutenir». Il a 43 ans, il est marie avec 4 enfants de 7 ans à 17 ans, dont 2 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de secondaire.

Emmanuel est agriculteur des tomates. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.

Pour faire croitre son agriculture des tomates, il planifie d’acheter d’autres champs pour augmenter la production des tomates. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être un grand fournisseur des tomates. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants et construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is part of the group Twisungane / Rhng. The group's name means "to support one another". He is 43 years old and married, and he has four children, from 7 to 17 years old, of whom two are in school. He has a 6th grade education.
 
Emmanuel is a tomato farmer. This loan cycle is his second one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor.

To expand his tomato farming, he plans to buy more fields to increase his tomato production. In the next few years, he would like to be a major supplier of tomatoes. With the profits, he plans on covering his children's schooling costs and build a house in which to live.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his tomato crop.

loans.name: Dilemia

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 19,526.50 pesos, Dilemia ha podido comprar más mercancía para tener suficiente en estock para el Día del Padre, que en la República Dominicana se celebra el último domingo de Julio. Dilemia inició este negocio en un área de su casa hace más de 10 años. Tomó esta decisión después de haber tendio a sus dos hijos gemelos, que ya tienen 13 años, pues no quería ser una figura materna ausente por causa del trabajo.
Dilema es madre soltera, es la única que aporta para el sustento y la educación de sus hijos. "Mi deseo es crecer como madre, mujer y comerciante, por eso quiero aumentar las ventas de mi negocio, para generar más ingresos y poder ayudar a mis hijos a terminar sus estudios"
texts.en:
With a loan of 19,526.50 pesos, Dilemia has been able to purchase more merchandise in order to have enough in stock for Father's Day, which is celebrated on the last Sunday of July in the Dominican Republic. 

Dilemia started this business in a section of her house more than ten years ago. She made this decision after having had her twin sons, who are already thirteen years old, as she didn't want to be an absentee mother figure because of work. 

Dilema is a single mother and the only means of support and education for her sons. "My wish is to grow as a mother, woman, and businessperson, so I want to increase sales in my business to generate more income and to be able to help my sons complete their studies."

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her stationary and personal items store

loans.name: Tuzamurane / Ghng Group

texts.fr:
Gemima fait partie du groupe Tuzamurane / Ghng. Le nom du groupe signifie «s’exhorter». Il a 44 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 5 ans à 22 ans, dont 2 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.
Gemima est commerçant. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des haricots, maïs, sorgho….pour le revendre.
Pour faire croitre commerçant, il planifie de donne le service de qualité pour attirer la clientèle. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le distributeur des haricots. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Gemima is part of the group Tuzamurane / Ghng. The group's name means "to encourage". He is 44 years old and married, and he has five children, from 5 to 22 years old, of whom two are in school. He has a 6th grade education.
 
Gemima is a merchant. This loan cycle is his first one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy beans, corn, sorghum… to resell.

To expand his commerce, he plans to provide quality service to attract customers. In the next few years, he would like to be the distributor of beans. With the profits, he plans on covering the schooling costs for his children.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, sorghum... to resell

loans.name: Twitezimbere / Ngrk Group

texts.fr:
Faustin fait partie du groupe Twitezimbere / Ngrk. Le nom du groupe signifie «décision de se développer des membres du groupe». Il a 34 ans, il est marie avec 5 enfants de 3 ans à 14 ans, dont 4 scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.
Faustin est agriculteur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.
Pour faire croitre son agriculture de riz, il planifie de louer d’autres champs pour augmenter la production et l’étendu de l’agriculture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être un grossiste et être le grand distributeur des maniocs dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire de ses enfants et acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Faustin is part of the group Twitezimbere / Ngrk. The group's name means "Decision to develop group members". He is 34 years old and married, and he has five children, from 3 to 14 years old, of whom four are in school. He has a 5th grade education.
 
Faustin is a rice farmer. This loan cycle is his second one with the microfinance institution ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor.

To expand his rice farming, he plans to lease more fields to increase production and to extend rice farming. In the coming years, he would like to be a wholesaler and the major cassava distributor in the region. With the profits, he plans on covering his children's schooling costs and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura tiene 50 años, ella es una mujer muy sociable y trabajadora. Actualmente vive con su hijo Juan, de 17 años, en la casa compró junto a su difunto esposo, quien la apoyaba en todos los trabajos que realizaban.
Ella se dedica a labrar la tierra, tiene cultivos de cacao, café y barbasco. Todos los días, muy temprano, se dirige a trabajar en sus terrenos, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha. Ella traslada sus productos desde su comunidad hasta los centros de acopio, ubicados a 20 minutos de donde se encuentra. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la cosecha, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos. Lleva 38 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es laborar en las temporadas de lluvia porque perjudica el mantenimiento de sus plantas. 

Este es su crédito número 20 con MFP, ya son más de 8 años que trabaja con el préstamos de esta institución y sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo.
Con este préstamo comprará fertilizantes para los cultivos que ahora tiene sembrados.
texts.en:
Maura, 50, is a very friendly and hardworking woman.  She currently lives with her son Juan, 17, in the house that she bought with her late husband, who supported her in all of the work that they did.  

Maura works as a farmer; she cultivates cocoa, coffee and mullein plants.  She gets up very early each day to go to work in her fields, because she knows that the money she gets for her products will depend a lot on the quality of her harvest.  She transports her products from her community to the collection centers located 20 minutes from where she lives.  What she likes most about her work is the harvest, because at this time she feels that the months of hard work have borne fruit.  She has been doing this type of work for 38 years, and what she considers most difficult is to work in the rainy season, because the rain can damage the plants.  

This is her 20th loan with MFP; she has already been working with this institution for more than 8 years.  She knows that she has the responsibility to pay back her loans on time, and she is ready to do that.

With this loan, Maura will buy fertilizers for the crops that she is now cultivating.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Jorge Paolo

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su pareja y su pequeño bebé recién nacido, él es una persona muy alegre, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; con mucho empeño Jorge pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación  Física, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las calurosas y acogedoras calles de la ciudad y en algunas ocasiones aprovecha la oportunidad para comer una deliciosa Patarshca, el cual es un plato típico de su ciudad hecho a base de pescado.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Jorge se desempeña como Profesor de Educación Física en un pequeño colegio de su ciudad, él labora un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor, ya que cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable y respetuoso que brinda a sus alumnos.
Jorge se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindad podrá realizar la compra de frutas estacionales de su región, tales como plátanos, papayas, piñas, entre otras; de esta manera Jorge espera poder vender dichas frutas en el mercado central de su ciudad, para así poco a poco iniciar su pequeño negocio de venta de frutas.
texts.en:
Jorge, 33, lives in the city of Pucallpa with his spouse and newborn baby.  He is a very cheerful, hardworking, enthusiastic person who with his spouse dedicates all their efforts to moving their family forward.  With much effort Jorge was able to study physical education.  In his free time he likes to go out for walks along the warm and welcoming streets of his city and sometimes takes advantage of the opportunity to eat a delicious “Patarshca” which is a fish-based dish typical of his city.

With much dedication and enthusiasm Jorge works as a physical education teacher in a small school in his city.  He works about 8 hours daily and feels good doing his work because he believes he does well because of the good way he does his work and the kind, respectful way he treats his pupils.

Jorge is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided he will be able to buy seasonal regional fruit like bananas, papayas and pineapples, among others.  In this way Jorge hopes to be able to sell said fruit in his city’s central market to gradually start his small fruit selling business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal regional fruit.

loans.name: Gregoria Del Rocio

texts.es:
Gregoria es una mujer de 41 años nacida en la ciudad de Quevedo pero que reside actualmente en Santo Domingo junto con sus tres hijos. Santo Domingo es una ciudad que ha recibido mucha migración de diferentes provincias del país debido a que ha experimentado un rápido crecimiento económico. Santo Domingo al ubicarse entre la costa y sierra ecuatoriana actúa como puente entre muchas ciudades importantes del país. Otra particularidad interesante de Santo Domingo es que hace poco cambio, de formar parte de la provincia de Pichincha a una nueva provincia “Santo Domingo de los Tsachillas.”
Gregoria es una madre muy dedicada a su familia y trabajo, actualmente está solicitando su segundo crédito y piensa utilizarlo en la compra de ropa para poder trabajar, para ella es clave el crédito ya que así podría comprar al por mayor y recibir mejores precios. Si Gregoria recibe este crédito estaría más cerca de realizar su sueño de construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Gregoria, 41, was born in the city of Quevedo but currently lives in Santo Domingo with her three children.  Santo Domingo is a city that has received much immigration from various provinces in the country because it’s undergone rapid economic development.  Santo Domingo, being situated between the coast and the mountains in Ecuador, acts like a bridge between many important cities in the country.  Another interesting thing about Santo Domingo is that it recently changed from being part of Pichincha Province to a new province: Santo Domingo de los Tsáchillas.

Gregoria is a mother dedicated to her family and to her work.  She’s currently requesting her second loan that she plans to use to buy clothes to be able to work.  For her, the key factor about the loan is that she will be able to buy at wholesale thus at better prices.  If Gregoria receives this loan she’ll be closer to reaching her dream of building her own house.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Segismunda

texts.es:
Segismunda tiene 56 años, está casada con Eulogio, de 60 años, tienen dos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor bienestar.
Ella es una mujer dedicada a la agricultura, tiene una parcela con cultivos de cacao, café y hoja de coca, es por ello que trata de dar el mejor cuidado a sus plantaciones, por lo que las sociedades recolectoras se han sentido satisfechos por la calidad de sus productos. Aun así ella se esmera a diario y le dedica buen tiempo a sus sembríos y lo realiza juntamente con la ayuda de su esposo e hijos. Sin embargo, en tiempos de cosecha necesariamente contrata jornaleros para acelerar la extracción de sus productos. Su plan a futuro es invertir sus ingresos en otro tipo de negocios, como abrir una tienda de abarrotes en su vivienda.

Este es su crédito número 19 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que contará con este apoyo financiero y está dispuesta a cumplir puntualmente con el rol de sus cronogramas de pago.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará más plantas de cacao para cultivar en su parcela y con el resto comprará abono.
texts.en:
Segismunda, 56, is married to Eulogio, 60; they have two children she wants to offer better wellbeing to.  She is a woman dedicated to agriculture.  She has a parcel planted with cocoa beans, coffee and coca leaves.  She tries to give her crops the best possible care and gathering cooperatives have been satisfied with the quality of her products because of it.  Even so, she strives daily and spends a good amount of time among her plants; she does her work with help from her husband and children.  However, during harvest time it’s necessary to hire day laborers to pick the beans more quickly.  Her plan for the future is to invest her income in another type of business like opening a grocery store at home.

This is MFP loan #19 and she’s very happy to know that she will be able to rely on this financial help and she’s willing to make her installment payments as scheduled.   She will use the 2,000 new soles from this loan to buy more cocoa bean plants to plant in her parcel and will use the rest to buy manure.

loans.use: to buy more plants and to buy manure.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania tiene 32 años, su pareja es Cirilo, de 35 años. Ellos viven en la casa que compraron durante los años de convivencia que llevan, donde habitan con sus dos hijos. 
Hace 5 años ella abrió una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda, empezó vendiendo pocos productos, pero con el transcurso del tiempo y los ahorros de ella y de su pareja, lograron comprara más víveres. Ella es una mujer perseverante, le gusta salir adelante para mejorar su calidad de vida y de su familia. Hoy se siente a gusto con la actividad que realiza y con los buenos ingresos que obtiene, su tienda tiene casi todos los productos que sus clientes requieren y les brinda una buena atención, por lo que su negocio es el más concurrido.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con su cronograma de pagos, y además está conforme con su banco comunal, ya que son personas que apoyan al trabajo de todos.
Con estos 300 nuevos soles comprará un saco de arroz y un saco de azúcar para la venta en su tienda.
texts.en:
Tania, 32, lives with her partner Cirilo, 35.  They live in the house they bought during the years they’ve lived together.  They live there with their two children.  She opened a home-based grocery store five years ago.  She started out selling just a few products but in time and with her and her spouse’s savings they managed to buy more groceries.  She is a persevering woman.  She likes to get ahead to improve her and her family’s quality of life.  Today, she feels good with the activity she does and with the good income she obtains.  Her store has almost all the products her customer need and she provides them with good service which makes her store very popular.

This is her first MFP loan and she commits to meet the payment schedule.  She is comfortable in her communal bank because the people all support each other’s work.  She will use these 300 new soles to buy a sack of rice and a sack of sugar to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice and a sack of sugar.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita tiene 39 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, su pareja es Nerón, de 44 años, con quien tiene un hijo, Roy de 15 años, a quien desea brindar un mejor provenir.
Ella y Nerón se dedican a la producción de cacao y hoja de coca, esta labor la vienen realizando desde hace 12 años, contando con sus propios terrenos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan su recompensa, para esta labor contratan a peones para que les ayuden a agilizar el proceso. Sin embargo, considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus sacos de cosecha desde su chacra hasta la ciudad, donde las comercializa, ya que se ubica a media hora de distancia y son muy pesados. Su otra dificultad es no poder contar con suficiente dinero para solventar los pagos, por adelantado, a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo con las cosechas, es por ello que acude a los préstamos.

Este es su crédito número 10 con MFP y sabe que este dinero le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por el resto de sus compañeros.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados comprará fertilizantes naturales para sus plantas de cacao y hoja de coca.
texts.en:
Rita is 39 years old and is a very hardworking woman. Her partner is Nerón, 44, with whom she has a son, Roy, 15, to whom she hopes to give a better future. She and Nerón produce cacao and coca leaves. They have been engaged in this work for 12 years and have their own land. What she most enjoys about her work is harvesting the fruit, because then she feels that the months of hard work have finally paid off. They contract laborers to help expedite the harvest. Nevertheless, the most difficult part is transporting their bags of crops from their small farm to the city where she markets them because it is located a half hour away and the bags are very heavy. Her other problem is not being able to depend on enough money to pay the workers in advance for their help with the harvest. Thus she has applied for loans.

This is Rita’s tenth loan from MFP and she knows this money will help her greatly in carrying out her work. In her communal bank, she is much loved by the other members. With the S/. 1,000 requested, she will purchase natural fertilizers for her cacao plants and coca leaves.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers for her cacao plants and coca leaves.

loans.name: Bernadette Sica's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Bernadette Sica, la responsable, est âgée de 38 ans. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants scolarisés, elle vend de la farine de manioc, du maïs et du sucre en poudre depuis quelques années. Dans le but d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et de renforcer son activité, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev en vue de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients et de maximiser son bénéfice. Le surplus lui permettra de contribuer à l'éducation de ses enfants et de diversifier son activité. Elle souhaiterait aider son mari à refectionner leur maison qui est en ruine. Bernadette Sica se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group of two persons who guarantee one another in solidarity. Bernadette Sica, the official of the group, is 38 years old, married, and the mother of four children, who are in school. She has been selling cassava flour, corn, and powdered sugar for a few years. 

With the aim of increasing her sales and bolstering her business, she requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev with the goal of satisfying customer needs and making the most of her investments. The surplus will enable her to help with her children's schooling costs and to diversify her business. She would like to help out her husband in renovating their house, which is in ruins. 

Bernadette Sica is at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of cassava flour, 3 sacks of corn flour, and 2 sacks of powdered sugar

loans.name: Yenoussi Adrienne's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Yenoussi Adrienne, la responsable, est âgée 46 ans. Mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux vont encore à l'école. Elle a un restaurant où elle prépare et vend des mets depuis des années. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. En vue d'augmenter son capital et de satisfaire les exigences de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un appui financier à Finadev. Cet appui financier lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins. Yenoussi Adrienne se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group of two persons who guarantee one another in solidarity. Yenoussi Adrienne, the official of the group, is 46 years old, married, and the mother of three children, of whom two are still in school. She has a restaurant where she has been making and selling food for years. She gets her supplies from the markets in Benin and from abroad. 

With the aim of increasing her capital and satisfying the requirements of her customers, she requested and obtained financial support from Finadev. This financial support will enable her to help with her children's schooling costs and to support herself. 

Yenoussi Adrienne is at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of  corn, a sack of rice, a basket of chili peppers, a sack of onions, and 2 baskets of tomatoes

loans.name: Zosima

texts.es:
Zosima tiene 65 años, vive en la casa que compró junto a su esposo Jesús, de 66 años. Sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes.
Ella se dedica a vender refrescos de fruta y golosinas en la puerta de su casa. Se levanta muy temprano para poder preparar las variedades de bebidas que ofrece, a pesar de su edad no hay impedimento alguno para que ella no trabaje. Esta labor lleva realizándola desde hace 10 años y a veces cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, pero él normalmente pasa más tiempo en su chacra. Para ellos lo más importante es seguir adelante, cada quien con su trabajo y así ambos generar un ingreso para el sustento de ambos. Zosima considera rentable su trabajo, ya que siempre tiene ventas por ser la única en su comunidad que vende refrescos, pues sus principales clientes son la gente agricultora que llegan cansados de trabajar y los alumnos de su comunidad, quienes se acercan a comprar sus bebidas y las galletas variadas que ofrece en su puesto. Por ahora su prioridad es abastecer su puesto. 

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP y se siente tranquila por contar una vez más con este apoyo financiero. Asimismo, agradece a su banco comunal por ayudarla, como hacen con todos los miembros.
Con estos 300 nuevos soles comprará dos recipientes nuevos para que siga preparando sus refrescos, con el resto comprará cajas de galletas, caramelos, etc.
texts.en:
Zósima, 65, lives in the house she bought with her husband, Jesús, 66.  Her children are all independent adults now.  She sells fruit drinks and snacks at her front door.  She rises very early to make the variety of beverages she offers.  Despite her age there is no impediment to keep her from working.  She’s been doing this work for the last 10 years and sometimes her husband helps her but he usually spends most of his time in his fields.  For them, the most important thing is to continue forward, each with their own work so that together they can generate income for both their support.

Zósima considers her work to be profitable because she always has sales because she’s the only one in her community who sells beverages; her main customers are farmers who return tired from working and students in her community who come by to buy her beverages and assorted cookies she has on sale.  For now, her priority is to stock her stand.

This is MFP loan #6 for her and she feels at ease because once again she will have financial support.  Also, she thanks her communal bank for helping her like they do all the members.  She will use the 300 new soles to buy two new receptacles to continue making the beverages and will use the rest to buy boxes of cookies, candy, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies and snacks.

loans.name: Chantale Michèle

texts.fr: Agée de 37 ans, Chantale Michèle est mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés. Elle vend des objets de piété depuis quatre ans et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la sous région. En vue d'augmenter de son chiffre d'affaire et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Ce micro crédit lui permettra de maximiser son profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle souhaiterait d'offrir des soins médicaux plus adéquats à ses enfants et d'agrandir son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
Chantale Michèle, aged 37, is married and the mother of three children, who are in school. She has been selling objects of devotion for four years and gets her supplies from one of the markets in the sub-region. 

With the aim of increasing her sales and fulfilling the expectations of her customers, she requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev. This micro-loan will enable her to maximize her profit and to help with her children's schooling costs. She would like to provide more adequate medical care to her children and to expand her business capital.

loans.use: to buy 6 boxes of candles, 40 small boxes of rosaries, and 25 porcelain statuettes

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: La Sra. Salome nacida en Chuquisaca de 52 años de edad, tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, ella junto con su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, en Villa San Carlos a 25 km de Limoncito donde tienen su parcela en la cual viven y trabajan, se dedican a la siembra de  maíz, yuca, y sandia, es el segundo  crédito que esta sacando con la institución  por lo cual se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que la institución le brindo ya que con el crédito comprara semillas para la siembra de maíz y también lo utilizara en lo que implica el preparado de la tierra para la siembra y despues sus productos lo comercializa en el mercado de zona directamente del productor al consumidor y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida. con el anterior credito le fue muy bien por este motivo desea invertir en la siembra de maiz.
texts.en: Salome, 52, was born in Chuquisaca.  She has three adult children.  She and her husband work in agriculture in Villa San Carlos 25 kilometers from Limoncito where they have their parcel they both live on and work.  They grow corn, manioc and watermelon.  This is the second loan they’ve taken with the institution and she feels very grateful for the support the institution provided because she will use the loan to buy corn seeds to plant and will also use it to do everything implied in preparing the soil for planting.  Afterwards, she will sell her products in the local market directly from producer to consumer thus improving her income and quality of life.  She did very well with the previous loan which is why she’s now motivated to invest in her corn crop.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: EL CLIENTE VÍCTOR ES RESIDENTE DE LA PROVINCIA CARRASCO, EL CLIENTE TRABAJA EN SU CARPINTERÍA DE SU PADRE HACE DOS AÑOS ATRÁS, NO CANCELA NADA POR EL USO DE SUS MAQUINAS DE SU PADRE,  EL PADRE LE APOYA EN SUS ACTIVIDADES POR EL MOMENTO VIVE EN LA CASA DE SU PADRE, AHORA QUIERE INDEPENDIZARSE Y PARA ESO NECESITA EL PRÉSTAMO PARA TERMINAR DE CONSTRUIR SU VIVIENDA EN SU LOTE URBANO QUE TIENE EL CLIENTE. ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE, SEGÚN LOS VECINOS EN EL LUGAR DE RESIDENCIA, Y CUMPLE CON LOS TRABAJOS RECIBIDOS OPORTUNAMENTE, ES SOLTERO. NO TIENE HIJOS DEPENDIENTES. QUE A FUTURO FORMARA SU PROPIA FAMILIA Y PARA ESO ESTA PROYECTANDO SU PATRIMONIO QUE SERA PARTE DE ESO SU VIVIENDA. DE LA MISMA MANERA QUE ESTA SIGUIENDO EL EJEMPLO A SU HERMANO. EL MERCADO DE LA CARPINTERÍA ES MUY GRANDE AQUÍ EN LA POBLACIÓN DE ENTRE RÍOS Y LA DEMANDA ES INSATISFECHA.
texts.en:
Víctor lives in Carrasco Province.  He has worked in his father’s carpentry shop for the last two years.  It doesn't cost him anything to use his father’s machines.  His father supports his efforts for the moment; he lives in his father’s house.  

He wants to branch out on his own now and to do so he needs a loan to finish building his house on the urban lot he has.  He is a responsible person according to the neighbors where he lives and he fills all his orders on time.  He is single and has no dependent children.  In the future he plans to form his own family and this is why he’s building his estate and he wants the house to be part of it.  He’s following his brother’s example in this.  Demand for carpentry is very large here in the Entre Ríos community and it’s unmet.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Oscar Alberto

texts.es:
Oscar, solicita un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en el negocio, pues considera ser necesaria la inversión en más helados de diferentes sabores por ejemplo paletas, vasitos, sorbetes, que son muy necesarios para el clima caluroso ya que sus clientes aumentan la demanda.

Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio y considera que a través de estos préstamos ha logrado fortalecerlo y mantener sus ventas, en su familia su situación se mantiene, ha logrado tener una mejor solidez económica para apoyarlos en sus gastos.
texts.en:
Oscar is seeking a new loan so that he can invest in his business.  He needs to invest in more ice cream and frozen treats in different flavors and varieties, such as popsicles, ice cream cups and sorbets.  These are in high demand currently due to the hot weather.

His goal is to improve his business.  He believes that through these loans he has been able to fortify the business and maintain his sales.  He has maintained stable financial conditions for his family, and he is in a better position to support them and cover the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy popsicles, ice cream cups and sorbets.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: La Sra. Lucila tiene  56 años, tiene tres hijo que ya son independientes. La Sra. Lucila se dedica a la  actividad de venta de ropa de manera ambulante va por los distintos mercados y zonas populosas de la ciudad de Santa Cruz ofreciendo sus productos, préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Lucila va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de ropa de temporada de invierno  como chompas y chamarras  y así de esta manera brindar variedad de sus productos  a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Lucila va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de ropa según la temporada, la Sra. Lucila es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Lucila, 56, has three children who are all independent now.  Lucila sells clothes from place to place in various markets and residential zones in the city of Santa Cruz.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution.  Lucila will use this loan to buy winter clothes like sweaters and jackets in order to have more variety of products on offer for her customers and to increase her profits.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business.  Lucila will use profits to continue buying a variety of clothing according to the season.  Lucila is a very hardworking person who feels happy for the opportunity provided since this is the only activity she has that makes it possible for her to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La Sra. Bertha tiene 50 años, es casada con un hijo de la edad de 19 años. La Sra. Bertha se dedica a la  actividad de venta de ropa de segunda mano, ella tiene su puesto de venta en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Bertha va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de un fardo de ropa de temporada de invierno  como chompas y chamarras  y así de esta manera brindar variedad de sus productos  a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Bertha va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de ropa según la temporada, la Sra. Bertha  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Bertha, 50, is married and has a 19-year-old son.  Bertha sells second-hand clothes.  She has a sales stand in one of the city of La Paz’s busiest markets.  This loan is her second sequence in the institution.  Bertha will use this loan to buy a bundle of winter season clothes like jackets and sweaters to have more variety of products to offer her customers and increase her profits.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business.  Bertha will use profits to continue buying a variety of seasonal clothes.  Bertha is a very hardworking person who feels happy for the opportunity since this is the only activity she has that makes it possible for her to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of winter clothes.

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es: La Sra. Cinthia tiene 27 años tiene dos hijos  de las edades de dos años y un bebe de seis meses,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio,  Que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Sewencani,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Cinthia utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de mercadería abarrotes por mayor como arroz y azúcar,   su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su negocio, la Sra. Cinthia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son desbalances en la economía local, ella va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando mercadería surtida. Su deseo por su negocio es que su tienda sea más grande y más surtida y de esta manera tener más clientes y por ende mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Cinthia is 27 years old and has a six-month-old baby and a two-year old child.  She sells groceries in her neighborhood shop, which is located in the area of Sewencani.  This is her third loan from this institution.  She will use the loan proceeds to buy groceries at wholesale, such as rice and sugar.

Her reason for seeking the loan is that she needs to supply her business.  She faces challenges in her business due to instability in the local economy.  She will use the funds to continue to buy merchandise for resale.  Her goal for her business is to expand her store and her inventory and thus be able to serve more customers and thereby increase her income.

loans.use: to buy groceries at wholesale, such as rice and sugar.

loans.name: Eddyc

texts.es: La Sra. Eddyc tiene 24 años tiene dos hijos  de las edades de siete y cinco años,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio,  Que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Magisterio,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Eddyc utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de mercadería abarrotes por mayor como arroz y azúcar,   su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su negocio, la Sra. Eddyc enfrenta retos en su negocio que son desbalances en la economía local, ella va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando mercadería surtida. Su deseo por su negocio es que su tienda sea más grande y más surtida y de esta manera tener más clientes y por ende mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Eddyc, 24, has two children who are 7 and 5 years old.  She sells basic staple items in her neighborhood store located in Magisterio.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution.  Eddyc will use the loan to buy merchandise like rice and sugar at wholesale.  The reason for requesting the loan is her need to stock her store.  The business challenge Eddyc faces is the fluctuations in the local economy.  She will use all her profits to continue buying assorted merchandise.  Her business wish is that her store is larger and better stocked so that she can have more customers thus improved income.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Elba Ibel

texts.es:
Elba, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para realizar la compra en 5 cerdos para la granja, esto le permitirá aumentar la disponibilidad en el negocio y en el futuro poder generar mejores ganancias a través de las ventas.

Con el préstamo anterior le permitió tener una mejor granja, poder realizar buenas ventas, hasta el momento sus circunstancias familiares están cambiando y las condiciones económicas son mejores todo a través de la buena administración del negocio.
texts.en:
Elba has decided to seek a new loan so that she can buy five pigs for her farming business. This will allow her to expand her business and allow for higher profits through future sales.

Her previous loan enabled her to make improvements to her farm and to achieve good sales.  Her family's financial circumstances have improved thanks to her skillful administration of the business.

loans.use: to buy five pigs for her farm.

loans.name: Darwin Vinicio

texts.es:
Darwin nació en 1991 y reside en Latacunga, capital de la provincia de Cotopaxi. Latacunga en una ciudad ubicada en la Sierra Central de Ecuador en las faldas del Cotopaxi, volcán activo más alto del mundo, que ya ha destruido a la ciudad tres veces desde su fundación. Latacunga cuenta con un clima templado y la temperatura promedio es de 12ºC. Latacunga tiene un paisaje único que mescla una arquitectura colonial con parte de la cordillera de los Andes. La ciudad también es gran representante del folklor ecuatoriana ya que cuenta con tradiciones tal cm la celebración de la Mama Negra, festividad que proviene de la cultura indígena, española, y afroecuatoriana.
Con tan solo 21 años de edad, Darwin inició su negocio de construcción de bloques que lo aprendió de sus padres. Por dificultades económicas Darwin nunca pudo terminar su estudios, pero gracias a su espíritu emprendedor el ha podido seguir adelante y ganarse la vida. El trabaja varias horas al día construyendo bloques, lastimosamente no tiene como proteger todo el material de la lluvia, y esto muchas veces daña el producto. Por lo tanto, solicita un crédito a Kiva para poder construir un pequeño refugio adicional y de esta manera proteger sus materiales de la lluvia entre otras cosas que los puedan dañar. De esta manera, Darwin planea aumentar su producción y poder tener más ingresos y ahorrar para comprarse una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Darwin was born in 1991 and lives in Latacunga, the capital of Cotopaxi Province. Latacunga is a city located in the Central Sierra of Ecuador on the flanks of Cotopaxi, the tallest active volcano in the world, which has already destroyed the city three times since its founding. Latacunga has a temperate climate and the average temperature is 12ºC [53.6% Fahrenheit]. Latacunga has a beautiful landscape that blends colonial architecture with part of the Andes mountain range. The city is also a great representative of Ecuadorean folklore because it features the celebration of Mama Negra, a festival that stems from the indigenous, Spanish and Afro-Ecuadorean cultures.

At only 21 years of age, Darwin started his business building blocks, a skill he learned from his parents. Due to financial difficulties Darwin was never able to finish his studies, however thanks to his entrepreneurial spirit he has been able to get ahead and earn a living. He works several hours a day building blocks. Unfortunately he has no way to protect all the material from the rain, which often damages the product. Consequently, he is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to build a small shelter addition and thus protect his materials from the rain and other elements that could damage them. In this way Darwin is planning to increase his production in order to earn more income so that he can save up and buy his own home.

loans.use: to build a small shelter addition and protect his construction materials from the rain.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia, a 52-year-old mother, is selling different kind of fishes that were caught by her husband in the river. She has been in operation for six years. She works hard every day just to meet the needs of her family. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy more fishes, styrofoam where she stocks her products, and a basin. 

She hopes to increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of her family, improve their poor living, and save for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy more fishes, styrofoam where she stocks her products, and a basin.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, who appears in the picture, is a 21-year-old single young man. He is a university student. His father is employed and earns a small salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs and pay the education expenses.

Ahmad wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Ahmad to do his homework and reports and help him in his studies. 

This will ensure a better future for Ahmad and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to help him in his university studies.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 27-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother to one son.

For the past three years, Abeer's husband has had a store for selling home products to customers. This has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family, but also not enough to cover the family's cost of living.

Abeer is requesting a USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing a new collection of home products for the store. This will offer to Abeer's husband a wide collection of home products that customers often request. 

This will increase sales and improve the family's income positively and create for them better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a collection of home products to resell.

loans.name: Chhen's Group

texts.en:
Chhen, a 49-year-old father of four children, three of whom are dependents and still in school, lives in a rural village in the Dambe district of Cambodia. The main sources of the family's income are rice farming on 0.5 hectare of farmland, which Chhen has doing for 29 years, and cultivation of a cassava plantation, which he has been doing for 7 years. Currently, he is able to earn about 15,900KHR per day.

Chhen has received four previous loans from Kiva partner VisionFund, all since repaid and all of which helped his family significantly in the cassava business. Now leading his group of two, he is going to use his loan portion to pay for land plowing and rice farming labor costs. Chhen hopes this loan will enable him to increase his rice crop production so he can earn more income to make a living better.

loans.use: to pay for land plowing and rice farming labor costs.

loans.name: Saroeum

texts.en:
Saroeum is 55 years old. She lives in a wooden house located in a rural area of the Kandal Stoeng district. She is married with five children, two of whom are dependents while helping the family's business. She is a rice farmer who owns one hectare of farmland while her husband is a construction worker for hire. She has been in this business for thirty years. Her business currently earns her about $13.63 per day, and she is able to save about $7 each day after expenses. 

Saroeum has been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, for two loan cycles and has completely paid back the loans. She successfully used the past loans to improve her family's livelihood. Now, she is requesting a loan of $1,300 to buy a car for her husband to run a transportation service. She hopes this loan will enable her to start another business for her family so as to increase her family's livelihood.

loans.use: To buy a car to run a transportation service

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald tiene 25 años, es un joven muy trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres, ya que es el único hijo y los cuida.
Él trabaja con mucho esmero para progresar con sus plantas de cacao y café, las cuales vende en la ciudad que se ubica a 20 minutos de su comunidad, donde ya tiene diversos compradores, especialmente en los centros de acopio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus chacras de las plagas, ya que tiene que hacerlo con mucho cuidado porque los productos químicos causan reacciones y teme por su salud posteriormente. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando porque desea comprar nuevas tierras.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y sabe que este dinero le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de sus cultivos. Además se siente contento por pertenecer al grupo de socios de su banco comunal.
Con estos 2,000 nuevos soles contratará jornaleros para que le ayuden a desyerbar las malezas que aquejan sus cultivos y con el resto comprará sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Ronald is 25 years old. He is a very hardworking young man who lives with his parents because he is the only son and he takes care of them. He works very carefully to improve his cacao and coffee plants that he sells in the city, located 20 minutes from his community, where he has several buyers, especially in the collection centers.

What Ronald most enjoys about his work is planting his land and making it fertile and productive. He has done this work for 5 years and considers the most difficult aspect to be fumigating his farms against pests because he has to do so carefully since the chemical products cause reactions and he is afraid for his health, later on. Hereinafter, he hopes to continue saving up because he wants to buy more land.

This is his second loan from MFP and he knows this money will be very beneficial for the development of his crops. In addition he feels happy to belong to the group of members of his communal bank. With this S/. 2,000 he will contract laborers to help him get rid of the weeds afflicting his crops and with the remainder, he will buy bags of compost.

loans.use: to contract laborers to help him weed his plants and to purchase bags of compost.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is requesting a new loan to buy a range of products, such as sugar, milk, and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.
